LPS1vYTVJbPiUYdqM8Qm1g.text: This is our go-to place when we're hungry and don't want to cook. We've taken guests here on several occasions and no one has been disappointed. The food is excellent, but it's always a guessing game with the level of spice. We always say medium because we don't know what we're going to get. We like spicy food so it's not a problem for us. Thai tea with boba is always a treat. We just learned you can bring your own bottle for dinner which will be helpful in the future.

ZLBuFWlJvL9PpPOgNQoyVQ.text: Great food as usual, their dipping sauces are some of the best, all with unique flavors that please the palette. Service was excellent and our server Aldo was outstanding. I would highly recommend Sala Thai.

photos.caption: Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. And of course Thai tea!
Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pot stickers, chicken satay and some great shrimp spring rolls, yummy!!!

atwbOb3TIjuQvYtQiMcang.text: OH MY GOODNESS!!!! My little sister told me about Sala Thai and I've been here 4 times in less than 10 days, YUP, it's THAT GOOD! I order the drunken noodles, YUMMY as well as the crab pulls, egg rolls with chicken, pad thai, fried rice and a taro boba. I love how sweet everyone is there. Atmosphere is darling and the restaurant, though found in a retail strip, YOU WANT TO GO HERE!!!! Perfect for kids too, especially if you sit by their super duper cool fish tank. We drive from North Scottsdale to Sala Thai to get the best Thai food we have found in the good ol' State of Arizona.

yQbtTzC_uyJ-hFut7HFC7g.text: I've been coming here for years but won't be any more after a bad pickup experience. I ordered #4  spicy (1-5 scale) red curry and pineapple fried rice. The curry tasted very bland, like key ingredients were missing and was not spicy at all. The fried rice was also off and was not good. I called them to let them know and they just said they don't fix orders unless items are mixed up. Customer service is definitely lacking, I won't be giving them another shot after this. Very disappointing.

5cOPYHyGkOg6AoFWOBOM4g.text: Another 3.5-er.  I'll make this quick since football's on:  ~ Basil fried rice - great ~ Spring rolls - average ~ Papaya salad - great ~ Red curry chicken - good ~ Chicken tom yum soup - good  ~ Drunken noodles with beef - great ~ Mocktails: we had one of each - mango, banana and pineapple banana.  The mango was the best.  There's no alcohol at this establishment, btw.  What good is a restaurant w/o alcohol?!

QB6O8M_lW3DSvXHhbylEjQ.text: For 22 years I was convinced I hated Thai food. Until I ate here and realized I was never eating the right stuff before. Sala thai changed my mind about thai food and now I crave it constantly!   My first visit I was greeted by the server with cool hair who recommended the drunken noodle and it was unbelievable. Now I am obsessed with their yellow chicken curry and thai iced tea. So the food is most important but this is a family business and one I feel great supporting. The guy with cool hair works every time I come in and always has a huge smile on his face. It's nice to see people enjoy their jobs. I only have positive things to say about all of their food, the cleanliness of the restaurant, and the staff. If you haven't been here yet... What are you waiting for?!

wo9z_0Vs_gBYs2U03uIfxA.text: Ordered red curry with pork and shrimp. Ingredients were fresh and tasty, but portion was somewhat skimpy for the price and the dish itself was uninspired (only a couple slices of bell pepper accompanied the meat). Both problems could be solved by adding some Asian vegetables to the mix at negligible cost. What really disappointed was the rice. It stuck together so badly, they could have sweetened it and called it a "Sticky Rice" dessert! Seriously, it was like the example of bad rice that sticks together on the Minute Rice TV commercial. Also, someone should tell them using plastic fish in an aquarium is tastelessly tacky. Either get real fish or get rid of the tank.

72lfLcLwNiWMPVUYMind4w.text: We had a wonderful meal here! We started with two fruit mocktails - pineapple and watermelon.  They were very refreshing, and at $3 apiece, well worth the price to cool some of the spiciness of the food (which was tolerable at a 3).  We had the crab wontons, tom yum, basil duck (which was the special) and spicy basil fried rice with beef. Everything was really great, and priced very moderately. The waiter checked on us consistently and everything about our experience was perfect. From the moment we sat down to the payment of our $45 bill - which is not bad considering how much we ate! GO. You won't be disappointed.

BQuRGZ48nufvFgqExc_NFQ.text: great food. Red curry is delirious. However the Pat Thai is too wet for us. We are not a big fan.

AaxXNCxedwbBfUjpk1Ebcw.text: Got a $60 to go order for the fam. Asked for lowest level of spicy ("1") so we could add heat individually at home if we wanted to. The food was fire! Like a 4. Not cool. (Literally). Food wasn't that great either, better Thai places around. Obviously won't be going back.

YFt3sKUUui3EoNfWdoihSw.text: Came in with my daughter Sun evening 6:45. The girl at the front tells us no tables you can seat here at the front if u want. The "front" is right next to the door and the cash register where everyone walks right by.  So we asked if we can wait for a table and she says NO. I asked her if she could take a look and see if anyone is close to leaving. There will be no tables for a long time everyone just sat down she mumbles. So I'm like, ok well maybe we will just order to go. And she hands us a menu. As she hands us the menu a couple walks in and sits at the other small table in the front. After about 5 min, a table leaves and they get sat!!  Meanwhile, we are still sitting here waiting for our take out. Its now been 20 min since we placed our order.  I pointed this out to the girl in the front and she dismissively says "sorry i made a mistake". WOW!  Boy are we going to miss Little Peking!!!

skc-QawLHbQlkMnsfGLI9w.text: I have ordered take out from this place many, many (hungover) times. Never disappoints me!! I always order pad thai and they cook everything perfectly and with the right amount of specified spicy (3 on a scale of 5.)  I have recommended this place to my brother who has also tried it out and liked it, as well as other family members. Food is always ready for picking up according to the time they tell me on the phone- nothing but great things to say!!

EUgRTddNsgZoExEZ8Uxvgw.text: The only dish we liked was Panang curry wich was ok and not perfect. We ordered Pad thai and Thai bbq chicken which was not at all good to taste. Thai coffee was good. Thai fish cake was another disaster better not to order again. I am not sure if i will go again to this place but if i go, i will try green curry or thai fried rice and will then update my review.

_KldJtaSqkqNO6HkqnfFQA.text: This place is priceless,.a big rip! I ordered the thai bbq ribs, well,its a cheap steak thrown on a grill wity thai sauce to dip it, i really need a steak knife to cut this steak,all i had ws a butter knife .wht i really needed was a buzz saw,.i would not give this to my dog!!

o1UYcY45XF5fLI8i2MDtFQ.text: We love coming here! It's in our neighborhood. Usually go at least once or more a month. Fav dishes are drunken noodles & green curry chicken!

h4QfzU8HtomOcqI5RZxqSg.text: Sala Thai always has great service and their food never disappoints. I live in the area and sometimes call in to pick up a meal and they're always prompt with their time frame. Yummy, affordable food and great service!

RSWRGOvZJ0kVs6LCt5L4EA.text: Love this place. Location is an a small strip mall off 32nd street. Authentic decor, small cozy atmosphere. Standouts for me are the Coconut milk Soup (tom kra gai) Papaya salad, drunken noodles and the boba tea

5EkIKNNhGTEPywj9G8zEDQ.text: Pad Thai noodles overcooked and chewy, and the duck curry was a bit too salty.  Might have been an off night - they seemed overwhelmed and we had to fight to get the waitress to bring our check.  Others around us were grumbling too...

i2qZSN-MQb5U3T9EE8y8SQ.text: SALA THAI....I just moved here from L.A. where there are dozens of Thai restaurants competing for cheapest lunch and best tasting Thai food. First time I came here the food was pretty greasy. 2nd time the service was  indifferent and snooty. 3rd time was the last time....terrible greasy garlic chicken. People that come here are white people that don't have any concept of the differences in races or nationalities or the kinds of food that makes ethnic food what it is or how it is supposed to taste People that come here are not worldly or not well travelled. Too bad....you've lost a customer. The food is overpriced for what you get.

_WiLuTpZJbgula8j7iOYiA.text: Google noted their Saturday and Sunday hours are 11:30 AM, nope they open at 12:00. The day I went (Saturday) they opened at 12:30, over 10 cars in parking lot, people peering in a restaurant with no lights on, funny! Half of them left thinking they shut down. I also left and returned 15 minutes later, staff said they had a rough night of drinking the night before, I understood !  I had the Drunken noodles, Red curry duck, Pork Satay, Pad Thai with Shrimp. Drunken noodles and Red Curry Duck (Awesome) Pad Thai, weird taste, brown sauce just had a strange taste. Visiting Thailand over 25 times, I know my pad thai but this wasn't good. Pork satay had a great taste and nice char but very tough meat.  I feel the prices are high for what you get and it would also be nice to enjoy the meal with a glass of wine or a cold Singha.  I will try this place again.

qiEvspwKYkZagd7TJ1WzSA.text: The panang curry is the best in metro Phoenix. No joke.

7Om8EPsmSnC0YMHSoXViXg.text: This is a cute LITTLE place and close to home so I want to love it but I just can't. We have been numerous times over the years but it looks like this last time was our last. The service used to be spot on and this time we spent lot of of time waiting. Waiting for a table, waiting for someone to take our drink order, waiting for our food, and then waiting a ridiculous amount of time for our check. My son actually sat with his hand raised like they do in school in hopes that someone, anyone, would come over to our table. I could hear the couple next to use complaining through their meal as well due to forgotten items and waiting for their server.  The food was simply ok this past visit. The flavors used to be vibrant and when you ordered something spicy it had some kick but lately everything just seems a little off and bland. We had pad Thai, sweet and sour chicken and a chicken red curry dish. None of the items were bad but they certainly weren't memorable either. The angel wings were a bright spot in the meal and recommended if you stop by. The Thai tea was also quite good.   If you are lucky maybe you will get a seat near the fish tank which gives you something to do while you wait.

wxjERu1VXLe6LUrjbqGf-g.text: Best Seafood Tom Yum I've had . Very fresh and tasty. I really enjoyed the food and will definitely go back .

BdlVWbSLpc0HLlIx92ELRA.text: Our go-to Thai restaurant. Love the food and the staff is always friendly. We usually get one of their curries (all are delicious) and the pineapple fried rice. The vegetable rolls are also delicious. Glad to have this place around the corner!

s5MtqjXzGV_WW4BVyOaWvQ.text: Sala Thai has excellent food, nice people. But the wait times have become ridiculous. Whether you order take out or eat in, expect a long, long, long wait. I've been come to Sala Thai for 10 years. Several years ago, they doubled the size of the restaurant wirhoit expanding the kitchen. Service has been a nightmare since.

Njcdc1RNRZKFVZUIzO-yIQ.text: Came here randomly just because I was in the area. Not really impressed with the food. The interior and the overall atmosphere of the restaurant is lively. I'd even say the place is pretty close to over decorating, but at least there's a lot to see. I was definitely mesmerized by their fish tank!! It had no real fish but a bunch of little ones that constantly floated around...geniusness!  Back to the food. Ordered pad see ew with chicken. The portion was pretty small and it lacked noodles. There was plenty of broccoli though. The Thai BBQ chicken was ok. Nothing too special about it. As for the garlic chicken, I don't even know if we got the right order? Our waiter said it was, but I would have renamed it crispy/deep fried chicken with some sort of sweet chili sauce? Don't know what happened there, but at least that portion size was decent.   Service was slow too. Even asking for hot water with lemon took twenty min. Ehhh just not too impressed overall.

re2nv2RyiRi0R1R1-fkcOQ.text: I just had my second experience with this place- both were on to go orders. First time I got the Tom Kra Gai and was pleased with it. Today I got the wonton soup and Panang beef curry. Both were good but the wonton soup was sooo good! The broth was excellent and it was not lacking in veggies or in the number of wontons they put in there! I was very pleasantly surprised. I walked in 10 minutes prior to them re-opening for dinner and was still greeted with kindness and was able to place my order right away. The young man at the counter (the owner's nephew) was so friendly and helpful in answering my handful of questions. I received above average service for sure. My food was out in a matter of 10 minutes max. Would definitely return.

xRcJXBnXIDpvVBdM3tKAmg.text: This is my first experience with Thai food in Phoenix and for the most part it did not disappoint.  I have never seen a Thai iced tea that was a 50/50 split of tea vs cream.  Terrible for you yes, but the extra richness suits me just fine.  It was a party of 15 so service was a little slow but like I said 15 people you kind of need to expect that but the staff was very friendly and there were no order errors which is always a plus.     Whenever I do Thai I almost always get curry.  Same here, I got the masmun curry with tofu and it was wonderful.  I wish there was a better rice to curry ratio as I had so much leftover rice, but I find there is never enough curry.  I also had a bite of my friend's drunken noodles and they were fairly good, but the curry was better. My one slight dissapointment was that spice level seemed off as I and almost all of my companions rated the spice level milder than what they were expecting.  I got a level 3 and felt like a 4 or maybe even a 5 would have been tolerable.  All in all though it was a great introduction to Phoenix Thai and I would happily eat here again.

ysn_7Djgs5fnbaT5hdzoAg.text: Yummy yummy! Best Thai place I have tried in Phoenix! I had the coconut milk soup and I couldn't get enough. Seriously you got to try it! The restaurant is in a weird strip mall but don't let the location fool you- because once you see the cute little place it's decorated like a charm inside. Only tried one thing so far (and I will be back soon to try more)- but if you like coconut milk soup you won't be disappointed

One of the workers told me that they purchased them from Thailand!

91UYOJfT_ncYxWXuhvtfUA.text: I have been back on a few occasions since my last review.  The dine in experience was great as they do not charge you a fee for opening your bottle of wine. The food has been consistently good. I did find out that the employees do not get to keep their tips so there is no need for tipping. Now the bad.  I did a pickup last week of what I normally eat there.  Pumpkin curry with shrimp.  The times I ate at the restaurant I was served 8 to 9 nice sized shrimp but when I got the take out I found only 4 in my order.  This combined with them now charging you a fee to open your bottle of wine I have now revised my 5 stars down to 3. I will now be on the lookout for another Thai restaurant with good food, good prices, and no fee for opening my bottle of wine.  (I usually bring my own opener and glass as I am capable of opening my own.)

AYE-DjFHKJkAD33mrIyqAg.text: This is me and my wife's favorite place. We come every week. The food is amazing and the staff is the best. Highly recommend.

PN-rj2KGPebsbMnVJ5-FDg.text: REally really good.  I had the Ginger Tofu dish ad it was amazing.  The place has the look and feel of a specialty restaurant run by a signature chef.  It's really a hidden secret, nestled in the back of a nondescript strip mall.  Don't let the surroundings fool you, this place is well well worth it.

J6rTp0FQ9Jwck2GOuUmRJg.text: Wow!  VERY VERY good! A very good friend recommend meeting here for lunch during a recent visit to Phoenix, and I'm SO happy that she did.  Sala is the best Thai I've ever had.  Sala is located in a very run-of-the-mill strip mall, and is a place you could easily overlook.  Definitely look for it and indulge.  My friend ordered a thai curry, and I ordered a hot seafood dish.  Both were amazingly fresh, flavorful, and generously-sized.  I cannot wait for my next Phoenix trip so we can enjoy lunch here again.

jh4erYYsbcm6KO8XtoOM0Q.text: Annoying that their phone rang for twenty minutes and the restaurant seemed to be understaffed, but tasty milk tea and musaman curry/phad Thai! Will go again.

7f2pXtgG08N_R4cTc7A0Hg.text: Sala Thai was the latest stop on my husband's and my quest for the holy grail, a.k.a. our search to find satisfying and authentic Thai food in Phoenix. I must say that Sala Thai is among the best places we've tried since we arrived here from California. We met Jim W and Audrey W (our fellow voyagers on our Thai food search) for dinner at Sala last Sunday night. As Jim mentioned in his review, Sala Thai isn't nearly as far away from South Phoenix or Chandler as you would think it is, especially on a weekend night when traffic is minimal. The restaurant was decently crowded when we arrived, but we got a nice booth just a minute or so after. It took us a while to decide what to order as the menu was huge and had a lot of new, interesting dishes like the "Thai Egg Bomb" (think Thai omelette, not the sulphuric smell released after eating too much Pad See Ew). After a long deliberation (thank you to our waitress for being patient with us!), we selected the pork satay appetizer, Pad Thai with chicken, catfish Panang curry, spicy basil fried rice with beef, and the duck curry. Just as at Swaddee (our favorite Thai place so far), we were asked to select a spiciness level from 1 - 5. We picked a different level for each dish, so we could see what the range of spiciness was like. Well, as Jim also mentioned in his review, the pork satay was disappointing - while the peanut sauce was great and not too sweet, the pork was overdone and chewy. The duck curry was decent, although it was a little milky for my taste. I prefer my curry to have a thicker consistency and less coconut milk. The duck was great, though, with a nice crispy skin. Similarly, the crispy catfish topped with panang curry could have been improved with a thicker and more intense curry. The fish was good-quality, however, and was definitely a nice mild compliment to the curry's spiciness. The real stand-outs for me were the basil fried rice and the Pad Thai. The Pad Thai had an almost meaty flavor to it (must be a different regional version of the dish than the sweet/sour or peanuty versions that are served at most Thai places), and was just the right level of sauciness. I was also impressed with the quality of the chicken. The basil fried rice was outstanding as well - the beef was perfectly tender and flavorful, and the crispy bits of basil added a wonderful flavor. Since the curries are what keep me coming back to a Thai place, I was a little disappointed that Sala's weren't as good as those I've had elsewhere in the area. However, our meal was highly flavorful and enjoyable, and I would definitely rank Sala up towards the top of the places we've tried in Phoenix (see my list at yelp.com/list_details?li...). Jim and Audrey - I look forward to the next stop on our tour!

8d7h2XbCJsY_wkgGqgjHgA.text: Decent Thai food, a little on the pricey side for the portion sizes. I tried the pad thai and the fresh rolls. Both decent, but nothing remarkable.

tr56yc62pWhA6Y3JuY6Xfw.text: My new favorite from this place is their Tom Kra Gai soup... The flavors are amazing! It is just SOOOO good and nothing I could ever replicate at home! Place is a tad pricey so I don't eat there as much as I would like to, but I still get take out about once a month and I have never been disappointed!

DRkxu0r-CAXrXo_n6JPQ5w.text: Over the top - excellent place.  I've had a a lot of Thai food in my lifetime, including several weeks in Thailand... and in my humble opinion, this is as good as it gets.  If you want great - I mean really great - Thai food, go here.  Try the coconut soup... I was tempted to lick the bowl.

4Nsod0kYjBfgJAAk42S8xQ.text: This place rocks, plain and simple. It seems to be run by one big Thai family and they know what they are doing. The service was better than expected but the food was even better. I ordered my usual Pad Se Lew (sp?) and was not disappointed. It is the best Thai food I have found in Phoenix. I'll keep trying new places but right now this is #1 for the area. If you have any other suggestions let me know!

30Mf0IHZb9NxSN1plEQR2g.text: We are regular visitor to sala Thai..excellent food and service...Red curry is best here....

fGHVKK62c7cTxXwvOZh5Mg.text: Tasty pumpkin shrimp curry, but I didn't like their pad thai that much.  Big fan of everything they fry, and I'm not usually so much for fried food. Their wontons and fried banana dessert with coconut ice cream were crunchy and perfectly formed. Drinks were also great. Prompt service and good prices.

oAQbc6lzjkeqpK7-CXN4aw.text: So I was born in Bangkok and lived there till I was seven, I may have forgotten my Thai language, but the flavors and foods are seared into me forever.  There is something that most Americans don't really understand about Thai food.  Everyone has their own take on recipes.  American food was like that at one point as well... thank goodness we still have our differences in BBQ styles...  anyway the point is what makes one Thai restaurant better than another is mostly preference, not authenticity.  That being said, Sala Thai's cuisine is the closest thing I have found to the delightful flavors of my youth.  There flavor's are all spot on and exactly the way they should be.  There ingredients are great quality (Where do they find kale that sweet!?!?) and make the food that much better.  There Prices are ridiculously low!  What is not to like about this place?  What you will get if you dine here; Friendly service (they are Thai, I don't think they know how to not be friendly), Excellent food (flavor and quality), at the best prices!  What you wont get; Anything Fancy, and you shouldn't Thai food is enough in and of itself!  Anyways check it out you wont be disappointed.  If it is to far West for you can check out Swaddee, though it is more expensive..  *edit*  The food is still great but the prices have gone up to the point where it isn't the same killer value it once was... still, great Thai food.

_sD3Yrg84hAGpnMXfXETfw.text: Love this place. Last time I was here, we waltzed in for dinner late one night; it was probably 8:40 and they close at 9. While at most restaurants, we would have been subject to dirty looks, we were quickly seated and served cheerfully.   The curries are all tasty - although with the duck curry, we were expecting a little more duck, but got a lot of curry instead. Now, the real winner is the Catfish with Curry Sauce. Holy moly. The Catfish is fried to perfection and topped with Panang curry. **droooooooooooooool** I love Panang. I love this dish. It is soooooooo good. And this place knows how to make a good spicy Thai dish.   Check your Entertainment book for a buy 1 get one 1/2 off coupon. But even if you don't have one, this place is worth a stop.

NZVcYIdG5Yth9X4m0ZEagA.text: Being from the food capital of the world, San Francisco, I am a second degree food snob.  I was stranded by circumstance in Phoenix for 18 months and couldn't find decent Asian cuisine.  Practically everything in Arizona is a chain.  I was very happy when Sala opened up in our neighborhood in 2006(?)  They let you order on a 1 to 5 scale of spiciness.  Being that people in the area had such sensitive tastebuds, we took a chance on the 4 and we were so happy.  The green bean dish with beef was out of this world - a nice balance of lemongrass, basil and heat.  Their green curry with chicken is bursting with fresh vegetables picked up from the farmer's market that morning.  The service is quick and efficient.  Towards the end of our stay in Phoenix, our little hole in the wall became increasingly crowded.  Going on a weeknight is a much better idea.  It's hard to keep a great place like this a secret for too long!

lE7tWFF4qlLWNz3ktEOYOg.text: I love Thai food. Love it. And this is the best Thai place that I've come across in Phoenix. I've tried a lot of their menu items and have never been disappointed. I also enjoy being able to select how spicy I want my food (1-5 scale). The service can be mediocre and they don't serve alcohol, but with food this good you won't even care.

tX3WTZ_O4Hy6G-LSbbdg7w.text: Try the coconut soup it's great if you like spice. Also the mango Bolba is delicious.

_qqTAUx1Jh7IiFFJ47mh0g.text: Food was good, but service fell apart. Didn't realize they were closing and things stopped without notice. No dessert, to-go containers, no nothing. Had to beg for the check. Skip this place and try one of the many other options in the area. Was excited to try it, too, and I brought my out of town family in. Too bad.

A45_uJCltd7qsuawRPY4dw.text: First let me tell you that I ALWAYS get Pad Thai and it is very good here.  Thai is one of my favorite foods and this is the place we always go to when I am at home.

MGtfTpLob_4niWDFc0bkbg.text: We went to try to eat there tonite after we called.  We were told the wait time was 25 min but that was not the issue. We were not greeted at all and not even looked at!!! It us rare to encounter rude Thai folks because they are generally kind...

dd9MyrpH_aDaWl700pgxhw.text: This is one of our favorite Thai places and as we walked in tonight we were happy to see they have expanded!

AwTDFl_2YD-1VKijZcWFdQ.text: Best Thai food in Phoenix. Consistently, good food. I love the Thai BBQ chicken and the green chicken curry. Great fast, friendly service.

dxsRQO4IZUXKvsp556Jeig.text: Excellent!!! Yellow chicken curry and drunken noodles are amazing!!

5BZ5WN0j22oI53z7vgkSmw.text: Ordered vegetarian pad thai to go. Serving size is good. Lots of vegetables, which I love, and you dont always find at other places. But the sauce is terrible. It's not traditional pad thai like I get pretty much everywhere else. I eat a lot of asian food, and lately, a lot of thai. Been to about 5 different places in the past week alone, and this pad thai dish was absolutely the worst. Maybe their other food is better, but steer clear of the vegetarian pad thai.

0N_kaIxEq0dCD7zTSkgKRA.text: Food here was good, but I prefer to have a little more sauce/oil with my noodles.  The flavors were good, but there was so little sauce in our pad se ew, that it was almost dry.  The Pad Ka (coconut lemon grass soup) was tasty, but there was no option to have a small bowl of soup, just a huge $10 serving.  It was a little thin though, not sure if that's cost cutting watering it down, or just they way they make their soup.  Service was fast though and restaurant was clean.

oSiU9Dj8PPYUIAMH-FBsWg.text: Very impressed with this tucked-away gem for Thai cuisine. The duck curry is phenomenal, probably the best in the valley. Clean and bright atmosphere. Cheerful and pleasant staff and service. Convenient location off SR-51. Very reasonably priced with generous portions.

ZbUxuEEGDdsazQHgr1_hHw.text: Our upper office meeting was held at Sala Thai yesterday.  Most of us eat out a lot because we are mobile and are meeting clients. So we are a particular bunch. This place is owned and run by an actual Thai family who visit Thailand and their family there.  The help are Thai and the food is authentic although as all foodies understand  versions of dishes vary by regions and by the chef/cook crafting each dish.   If every chefs/restaurants dish tasted the same life would be boring!!       The Curry is exceptional no matter what type, the usual dishes we enjoy are always freshly cooked.    The owners will not serve my favorite Mango with Sticky rice (heaven) unless just the right mangos are available.I also get carry out from here several times a month and am always pleased.   Their lemon chicken soup drives away my colds.   The ice cream they make fresh with coconut milk is wonderful.  This is usually a peaceful, low noise get away with a large clientele.  As for those that want alcohol , most of us go to have amazing food---- several bars are close if you need alcohol.

71cZ37YzkDDFvEVYmZeN2Q.text: I want to like this place since it is close to home...but, the food was just okay. The pad Thai was alright and the crab Rangoon was actually wonderful, but overall I find the favors lacking. I will try it again with the hopes I just chose the wrong entree.

xqjk5PAplEnY9DYlbzAhuQ.text: OK, I've eaten here twice and gotten the same things both times - Shrimp Pumpkin Curry. It's amazing. I never knew I liked cooked pumpkin until now! The service is OK, but really it's the food that's great. The ambiance is what you'd expect at a Thai restaurant. Tonight was especially fun sitting next to the fish tank with about a hundred fake fish swirling around in it. It held my daughter's attention at least. I'm taking off a star for the prices, which I consider to be a couple dollars higher than I'd like to pay for a strip mall restaurant like this. In all though, I'd recommend it!

QUTZpDBDGl6woM6DkI5a-g.text: First Thai place I've been to in Arizona.  The place is decently sized compared to other Thai places I've been to.   Looks like a family owned business with the whole family working together.   Ordered their beef salad, pad thai, and thai fried rice.  Figured if those are decent, then we can try other food here next time.  The beef in the beef salad tasted like beef jerky, but the seasoning was good.  I've never had beef jerky salad before. The pad thai was good, but I've had a lot better elsewhere. The thai fried rice was probably the best thing that we had there.    The service was mediocre.  Another family came in after us and ordered after us, but somehow got all their food before us.

qrwp4JuC0fHKLGaqKrJonA.text: This place has the best green curry and spicy basil dishes I have found in AZ. Prices went up from when they first opened, but still reasonable.  I still return every time I return to visit from San Diego, and I haven't even found anywhere as good as Sala Thai in my two years there! Sewatdee Kalb!

7rCHDqRqqbDC9IM3Q6Wk_Q.text: This is our favorite Thai restaurant in the area.   We love the Tom Kra Gai (Coconut Milk Soup); I would go there just for that.   We also enjoy the various Curry dishes on their menu.   The service is fast and the best part is that you can BYOB. (Well that and the cool little fish tank...you'll have to see it to understand.)   When we're too busy to eat in, we do their carry out often as well.

gw3m51EYXW1OhDnQXLEUwg.text: We live by and will definitely do take-out again, although it is a bit more pricey. The chicken curry was SO good that I didn't try anything else!! Pad see-ew is good according to my husband.

Zp_3LUTsr_EnBB8svNTd_A.text: I have been looking for great Thai food, my daughter brought me here.  The drunken noodles are the best I've had!  The vegetables are fresh and firmly cooked, the noodles are perfectly spiced and not too oily, and the chicken is tender.  I can't wait to try the coconut soup, pineapple fried rice and the spicy green beans....excellent menu!

Czhf4OYY0t9qmL65F1g70w.text: Very good food. very authentic. one of the best Thai food I've ever had.  Must try this place

uJPSoh7jG4YsfEk92g6xSg.text: I have been eating at Sala Thai for at least 4 years now.  I thought I had done a review, but I guess my "Brain to Yelp" Implant wasn't working that day.  Anyway, this one of the best Thai restaurant I have found in the Phoenix area and they have an extensive menu that should have something for everyone.  I generally get the Thai Omelet with Pork, or if I feel like getting a variety by trading portions with my wife I'll get veg/tofu dish.  The omelet is stuffed with your choice meat, clear noodles and other good things. It is not greasy at all and has a fluffy texture.  It is severed with a side of fish sauce to drizzle over the omelet.  We have tried several of the veg/tofu dishes with Spicy Green Bean, Spicy Ginger, Pad-Woon-Sen and Spicy Basil Leaves being the highlights, but all the dishes I've tried have been tasty and fresh.  Last time my dad was in town we took him here and he ordered the Chicken Satay to share, it had a fresh grilled taste and had a nice dipping sauce.  The majority of the dishes can be prepared with your choice of meat or tofu for the protein and you select the level of spiciness you would like.  They also have a vegetarian page in the menu that includes some appetizers and entrees prepared vegetarian.   They have expanded the dining area, so now you rarely run into long waiting times that was once a problem here. One of my favorite things about Sala Thai is their "mocktail" drink selection including several fruit flavors, Thai iced tea, Thai coffee and I believe they also recently added Boba style drinks.  They use to have a dish named "Son-in-Law Egg", but I think they took it off the menu.  Unfortunately, I was never brave enough to try it... Maybe if you ask they can still prepare it.  Also, they have opened a Goodyear location on Litchfield Rd south of the I-10 for those you out west.  This is great place if you like Thai food, want to introduce someone to Thai cuisine or have a party with people with several different diet/lifestyle choices.

photos.caption: Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cute Salt and Pepper Shakers
Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thai Omelet, Spicy Green Bean Tofu, and Thai Iced Tea

brdI3F4tUE1iQ7lRK2HNUg.text: This place was horrible.  Check the food administration website for health code violations before you go.  I thought I should have made a 360 right out of there when I saw the plastic floating fish.  Disgusting food and poor excuse for Thai food.

3P1HVlgX_FhsluOOtsntKg.text: The food is very good.  However, both their portion sizes and their customer service sucks.  Two times our to go order is wrong.  Either my vegetarian husband gets meat in his meal or I get tofu in mine and I wanted chicken.  Sick of constantly having it wrong - or having one dish get cold while we make a second trip to get the other corrected. Also,  noodle dishes don't even full half the box.   Staff is rude...won't do anything for the mistake.  If you order,  be sure to check everything before you leave!!

7I9LDXs4Yh8oA68815vB3w.text: I've only ordered takeout so far, but I love the interior of the place, the food is good and the people there are very friendly!

FJVedvWjRyD3OYZqQ9Sw1w.text: i usually get take out from this place. I've only tried the pineapple fried rice and pad see ew (which is the large flat noodles with beef). i usually get it extra spicy 4 out of 5 on the spicy scale. when they do make it spicy for me then it's really good. i think I've ordered from this place a total of 10 times and maybe 3 of the times they didn't make it spicy at all. it was bland and i had to put my own spices in it. i was so disappointed.  it's gotten better though after i called and complained that when i order it spicy i mean it and not be disappointed when i get home.

_xXhDugCnFY0RRFCan6KNg.text: I LOVE Sala.. and you dont have to be a Bala to go & feast.. I will say that the medium spice.. dang.. shouldve gotten the mild.. but had the Panang & pineapple fried rice.. awesome food.. mediocre service.. but Ill take it.. just with a lot of water..:-)

HM4j1AJUr2m70nsNy2Cw8g.text: Thought I should do a little review on Sala Thai while enjoying my yummy leftovers from last night.  Eating the Lad Na straight from the box, cold!  The value blows my mind.  The freshest and most authentic Thai in my opinion.  And it's BYOB!  This is not a seen and be seen kind of place.  Go to Roka Akor is you are looking for that vibe.  Sala Thai is a little "mom and pop" gem where the focus is on delivering delicious Thai cuisine.   The highlights for me are the shrimp pumpkin curry, egg bomb, and larb.  I get an endorphin rush every time I eat those dishes.  As of late we order take out from Sala every 2 weeks and are consistently blown away by how good the food tastes.  I have only 2 issues.    Their servers need to write down the ordered dishes.  Twice now we've had one particular server who has goofed up our order.  Don't mind waiting a bit for the kitchen to expedite a forgotten dish but when you have your 6 yr old and infant in tow you should NOT have to wait 45 min for your kid's dish to arrive (everything else on the table was too spicy).  They did comp us for the dish but I was glad that wasn't my first time in the restaurant or else we would have been robbed of frequenting the best thai place in the valley.      Second issue.  There needs to be some consistency with the heat scale.  Sometimes a "4" yields a dish that is only slightly spicy and other times a "4" is off the charts too hot.

m184hsuhJyrjSfViVW6Fiw.text: I grew attatched to this Thai place by my old work but since I moved I have been hesitant to try a new one. This place did not fail me! Great, attentive service. Never bugged the table or interupted coversations. Anything you asked for was out promptly. I had the Tom Yum level 3 spicey. Wow! Was it hot, extremely tasteful & enjoyed with with a side of rice and egg rolls. Very nice portion size and I got the small. Will definitely be back!

AYY-5ynhVySj-XYtkxFqLw.text: Not impressed at all. Had the coconut soup and phad Thai. It tasted like it was one of the "instant" bowls. I've had Thai several times in my life, I've even purchased some of the Thai instant stuff for my home. The taste was ridiculously similar. It wasn't a good experience at all. I won't be back, unfortunately. I was really excited about this place seeing all the reviews.

tBAjMk-6MGO377VRQEm_TQ.text: This used to be one of our favorite Thai places but the last couple of times have been a disappointment. JCV42hSBJIWuIX7wlZ4WSg.text: *This is a review for PAD THAI ONLY!*  I love Pad Thai, I searched for about 30 min on yelp to find a good Pad Thai place.  I had 3 in mind and they were all pretty close by including this one, but since I wanted to go, I chose this place since it was closest to the highway.  Honestly, the Pad Thai was little disappointing. I'm sure their other foods are great, but probably not the Pad Thai. I'm no expert or a Pad Thai snob, but out of all the ones I had, this might be my worst (or second worst) Pad Thai I've ever had.   The noodles were overcooked, and I was expecting more green onions, but they were only few short ones lying around. They charged 3 extra dollars for 5 fairly good size of shrimps, which wasn't too bad.  They did put a reasonable amount of bean sprouts and slides of carrots, so that was good.  Also, they put a good amount of peanuts (I think it was peanuts), but I chopped up some roasted salted almonds at home and added them for extra taste, which made it little better.  The sauce wasn't too bad, but it would've been better if it was little spicy and saucier (not salty). It was little too bland for me. It almost feels like eating a top ramen at a ramen place, and thinking that I could've just made it at home.  This would be more like a sad Pad Thai that I would probably reuse the leftover to add more stuff or even make spring rolls out of it.  I'm sure the service is good and all, and I have not tried other food since I normally just go for the Pad Thai. And please remember this is a review just for the Pad Thai.  It looked like a family owned place, and I wish and hope the best for them. If you're owner or worker who works there reading this, please .. save the Pad Thai #RIP #PadThai Thank you.

CZgLwW58qB599c7rlzXQ4g.text: The worst! Food and service are pathetic. Watery curry which finally came 20 minutes after the rest of my table, so I took it to go. Probably wouldn't feed it to my dogs.

Well, I really like that dish, and can't frequent a place that doesn't serve it.  So when I am craving curry, this is the place I'll go. It looks like they are expanding into the space next door so they may have room for larger groups in the future.

7vrcAVEDq-yu8hpx7WPtuQ.text: Returned again a couple of nights ago and the service was much better!  Had the Pad Thai, Shrimp Peanut Curry, and the Pork Ribs. hZiRCAn7ob86qh_nOu0ZPA.text: This place rocks.  I go out of my way at least once a month to eat here.  Food is unbeleivably good.

5g-SwVORU0NpsWMeKydNyg.text: I decided to try this place after reading the reviews on yelp. I had the beef with brocolli with steamed rice and the beef satay. Their food was delicious and it's probably one of the best that I have had in awhile. I'm very glad that I tried this place out and I will definitely be returning :).

56LSHZuYvRZ22P8NRAskUQ.text: We had eaten there once before on a recommendation from a co worker of my wife. She is of Thai descent, therefore she should know. The food was exquisite in taste and we really loved it. We did notice that the amount of meat within the dish itself was maybe a little skimpy but didn't think much of it. Then last night we decided to go with a couple of friends to eat there. We spoke so highly of the place and even told our friends that we loved it way more than Thai House on Shea where we had been with them before.   The dishes came and we were blown away. The bowls of Red and Yellow Curry that my wife and 2 friends ordered looked like kid's portions. The amount of food in the bowls was minimal. The amount of meat was again skimpy bordering on non existant. I had the PadThai. The flavor was authentic and delicious. There was only, however, three small pieces of chicken breast and two shrimp.   The issue here is the fact that almost every dish is now around $10 and the portions are too small. For this kind of money, I expect more meat. I am not sure if we will be going back. I would say something, but not too sure if they really would care.

Ilendqg3aTdgCAC_YZGqEw.text: Consistently fabulous food!  This is a once a week must for us.  Love to try something different every time we go.  We love that it is BYOB!

04uN97V1axaSeQg9-aehCg.text: So far, my favorite Thai restaurant in Phoenix.  I faced a lot of disappointments and mediocrity before I found Thai Lahna and crowned it my valley favorite, but while I have enjoyed consistently good Thai at Thai Lahna, I have never gotten that glorious rush from eating their food.  The first time I tried anything from Sala Thai, my girlfriend ordered me Green Curry to go after dining there with her mother.  When she requested it Thai Hot, the server politely giggled behind her hand.  That curry was the single spiciest thing I have ever eaten.  I am accustomed to spice, but the girl took one bite and promptly ate two slices of bread to cool her esophagus.  I don't know if the spice dispenser malfunctioned, or they felt like messing with us or what, but it was basically a little cardboard trapezoid of napalm.  Even then, the delicate, sweet, earthy, volcanic flavors of their green curry came through.  A week or so later I found an excuse to try a visit to Sala in person.  I am often crippled by extensive menus, I find myself agonizing over the whole concept of "But what if one of my all-time favorite dishes is on this menu, but I choose the wrong thing and never come back, and my life is .003% less satisfying...", and the Sala Thai menu features pictures that make everything look delicious.  Ultimately I chose to go with Spicy Eggplant, which is out of character for me, because in trying any new Thai restaurant, my two defaults to establish a barometer are Green Curry and Pad Thai.  If you get those right, I trust you to do everything else.  So my Spicy Eggplant hits the table...you know those moments when food looks so spectacular that you're almost embarassed to defile it by eating it?  That was the case here, and not because it used fancy technique or elaborate chef-driven painting with sauces, but because the produce was so fresh, and the balance of colors so gorgeous, it essentially became some sort of accidental, outsider pop art.   Or something.  The important part is that it was exquisitely delicious.  The eggplant's texture was silky as it should be, the balance of sweet, savory, earthy and spicy was perfect, the rice was the proper consistency..it was what I want Thai food to be.  I have not been to Thailand, I have no close friends or relatives of Thai descent, I haven't read an encyclopedia of Thai cooking.  I only know that my mouth and belly left pleased as they have been by no other Thai place in town, and that is good enough for me.

EmjG0prEqJFbHBoRGBFxVA.text: This place is great. I just moved to PHX and I've been looking for a good Thai restaurant that serves up the real deal. I've been a few times to make sure that it deserves the 4 stars, and it does. It's fresh, friendly and delicious. It's definitely not a "let's go out on a Friday night" place, but it's great for lunch and low key dinners. I don't eat meat, so I can't vouch for that, but the shrimp dishes are really good.

5HK8Subl4uduZVl0bfthtQ.text: Consistently good although sometimes a little slow when they are busy on Friday and Saturday nights. Weeknights and lunch are better. We like the yellow curry, chicken satay and Thai Iced Tea. The noodle dishes are good too. When we go out for Thai, we prefer Sala Thai over any other Thai food we've tried in Phoenix.

2k-kVYWm6_XdCorCWKgreQ.text: Great.  It's a nice little hole in the wall Thai place.  They make really great spring rolls and only had Pad Thai and Panang, but both are awesome!

UXofq9Q32X6BeCsgnd8Mvg.text: My wife and I love this place.  Thankfully we live only a few blocks away. We order out  once a week, yum. It does get busy, so I try to time my order before 6pm. I like the fact that they are so calm, even when they are super busy.

fNbkcj_N7DmWVwAtgeBt1w.text: Came here for dinner. We got   Thai iced tea: very good  Thai spring rolls: fine but nothing special  Red curry with pork (4 out of 5 on the spicy  scale): this was a very good dish  Pad Thai: very weak dish. Not authentic and not very good.   Pad see ew: excellent and best thing we had.

qFCA7PWZZhpvKH4G6u9pUQ.text: This place is amazing! We ordered the yellow curry with chicken (spicy level 2) and it was amazing. The egg rolls were delicious too. Great price for what you get and the service was great. I especially liked the fish tank with the rubber fish in it. 10/10 would recommend!

o2sT3GlY-4T9jC5HpjJMIw.text: Picked up dinner consisting of masuman curry, drunken noodles and pad thai.    The food was not the same as our other visits.  Rather than the very good experience the food was mediocre at best.  The masuman curry was not even close to previous efforts.  Frankly I could recognize it was curry but not strictly masuman curry.  The Paid Thai was also off from their usual effort.  As if the Pad Thai sauce was the one I get in a bottle from the Asian market.  Could have been an  off night.

0yECa05EpwRHSlr1PQ2_WQ.text: Best Thai In North Phoenix Our family ate at Sala Thai this evening for the first time. We have been to a number of Thai restaurants in the Valley......this is one of the best. Food is flavorful, spice it as you like, and the service was superb. Spring rolls were great, followed a wonderful soup (Tom Kra  Gai), and Thai BBQ......everything was perfect. Finished off with Fried Bananas served with homemade Coconut ice cream. You won't be disappointed.

7h5az3UWH3HuRSOIaz5uEg.text: First time going to Sala Thai. Worst experience and will not return. I've been to a lot of Thai restaurants and so figured I'd give this one a try. Definitely will not go back. We were one table of 6 with 2 other tables in the restaurant. The service was very poor. Took 30 minutes to get our drink & food order in, another 50 minutes to get our food. Boyfriend's fried fish plate, once he bit into it, had completely raw fish inside. He asked for a new dish. 20 minutes later they still had not informed us about the whereabouts of his dish. Was his birthday meal and since everyone was about done we asked where his dish was and the server told us "Oh, they are just about to make it". We then decided to cancel dish since the meal experience was over. They did not take the dish off of the final check and we had to ask them to remove it bc he didn't get to eat his meal at all nor would it have been with the rest of the family by the time it would have been brought out. Needless to say that the hassle that came along with the meal could have been avoided. Would not recommend if you have a table of 4 or more.

_47MCimVW9pljk9r18Z4qg.text: Based on only two meals I give them an above average rating for Thai Cuisine. We had the special of the day that was spicy duck basil. The duck was prepared surprisingly good and the flavors seemed right. We also had the spicy pumpkin basil with ground chicken. The chicken wasn't that supermarket kind of ground but was more like chopped up well chicken that was moist with some developed flavor and not just cooked and tossed in. The flavors were about right. If I knit pick I can say the dish would have been better if the pumpkin was cooked more because it was slightly crunchy and the basil should have been broken down more instead of being like mini branches of basil. But over all we both were pleased and plan to return.  The decor is very tacky but in a good way. Fake fish swimming in the fish tank. and stuff glued on the walls everywhere. Novelty hugging salt and pepper shakers are for sale for $3.@.

photos.caption: Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy Pumpkin Basil with Chicken
Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy Basil Duck

bWw_zI9wLXBw1vVwxqraKA.text: Favorite Thai restaurant. My favorite dishes are yellow or red curry, spicy basil leaves with chicken, chicken clear noodle salad, and coconut soup. The flavors are perfect.

9ilrhLOwnroiCAxCWhoUpQ.text: Food was ok, what gets me at restaurants is service. The waiter chatting with customers...which is fine, but if you have other customers waiting, you have to cut it short. Very forgetful waiter, and the worst thing about it is that he doesn't even know he lacks skills.

P9EzAxRqY_5WZpJIj_Cqfw.text: Excellent little restaurant! The food is of great quality. The Thai tea and the mocktails are delicious. The presentation of the food itself is stunning.   We went around 3:45 in the afternoon on a Tuesday and the place was empty. The quiet atmosphere and the decor were a plus. The decorations add a nice touch of classic Thai culture. I definitely recommend this place. I know I'll be returning!

QBq2OivOXHjp_PXFcQYzdw.text: I went with my family to Sala Thai this evening.  We sat down and ordered very quickly starting with an appetizer of angel wings (stuffed chicken wings with clear noodles, onion, carrots, and ground chicken).  We then ordered dishes for the seven of us:  two orders of Pa-nang curry, Thai fried rice, drunken noodles with tofu, spicy eggplant with tofu, grilled salmon, and the special (basic leaves duck).  The angel wings were a hit!  The other dishes were for the most part very good.  The eggplant was a little oily though the sauces were great.  The drunken noodles were okay.    As a hint to any Yelp readers, be very careful with the numbers (0-5) of how spicy you would like it.  We all ordered numbers between 1 and 3, and it appeared that those of us who rounded up found our dishes a bit too spicy while those of us who rounded down found the dishes just right.  Sala Thai also allows guests to bring their own bottles of beer or wine (though I do not believe they serve their own though I could be mistaken).    While two of my family members go to Sala Thai on a regular basis, most of the rest of the family had never been there before.  This was my second time and while the restaurant is good, it really didn't stick out as a unique Thai restaurant.  It is definitely worth checking out (as I am sure it is a great restaurant for others).  There is also plenty of parking available outside.

yQm9nRunAjMm95BeJznYXw.text: My favorite Thai restaurant ever! I usually get take-out from here, but have eaten here more than plenty of times! Everyone is always so nice, and the food is always hot and ready in a few minutes. They have never messed up on my order, and everyone is always really sweet when we go eat there, or when I get take out. The food is very authentic, priced very reasonable, and the menu has a HUGE selection of all sorts of Thai food. I love it here!

n-akL-pENoIhZFjNVgcSeg.text: Lettuce wraps are amazing.. I could eat them at least once a week.. However the staff doesn't speak great English so it's hard to ask questions about the menu..

Xu2E4AyJnHiGhFw8_eHnug.text: Excellent spicy basil fried rice! I've gotten it twice with extra hot spiciness and it's been awesome! I also tried the chicken dumplings and they were really good. If you ask for some spicy paste they'll bring you 4 different types FOUR! awesome variety. I would recommend it for most people!

photos.caption: Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sweet basil extra spicy!

dTPL5iO_14tKBRV7Fa4-CQ.text: Food = delicious!  Service = not great We got the Tom Kra Gai soup (coconut soup) and it was really good, not the best I've had but solid. Also fried rice and the pumpkin basil dish (#80).  Overall I will try another place in the area before coming back. Service is really important to me and it is just really lacking here.

TRdl20idGEqAN7eqs2BIfw.text: Some of the best Tom yum soup I've ever had! Sala Thai catfish is incredible! Got my Thai fix tonight! Plastic fish are fun but I don't know what they feed them....

1_xEEIMNCZZgdcLabuSSbw.text: How do you judge a Thai restaurant? You judge them on the simplest dish, i.e. pad Thai! This place could not even get their pad Thai right, as it more like some chewy noodles that were insipid. I don't understand why and how people can rate this place so highly, and all I can say is that I feel sorry for people who have yet to experience good Thai food. I will avoid this place on my trips to Phoenix.

2pzm7ReMiE97vVh4wO5b3A.text: Food was hot, salty, and tasted ok, but I am assuming they use massive amounts of msg as it made both of us sick. Service was mediocre.

ZPj14Zadywio3O-_qy1RMA.text: I would not normally Yelp but in this case I feel that I would be doing the owner a disservice. We arrived at 11am when the restaurant is suppose to open. The security gates were still on the windows and the server did not acknowledge that we were standing outside. We waited patiently until 11:06 when she opened the door and I asked her if the restaurant was open and she mentioned that she goes to school and can't get here by 11. We walked in and she said we could sit anywhere she then proceeded to put the gates away and set up all the tables and chairs outside and inside before she greeted us finally at 11:16. It would have been nice if she would have said one moment I'm just trying to get the restaurant open I apologize for the wait. The food was great!

UZlIZRH-n7Ax9vfCQE3K0A.text: The little cute place got pretty ok food. I don't like how they served us. The waiter literally put the plate on the end of the table, instead of being in front of us. Also, I don't like their Pad Thai

mqdGuwFfVkm71GLrxN_-rA.text: Best Thai food restaurant in town. We have been here several times and the food is always consistently good. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Great for vegetarians as well. The best thing is its BYOB!

hSKlgfHvgxDkNU2-CXcX2w.text: Really felt like trying a new Thai place in the area. Had good reviews, so we came here one Saturday night. Give this place 3.75 to be precise. It was pretty low key for dinner, quiet, 2-3 other parties while we were there. It was a cozy space for sure, we had a nice booth to ourselves. The fish tank full of plastic fish definitely added to the ambiance....  We started with veg egg rolls. Crispy and delicious. We didn't get a chance to ask if the sauce was without fish sauce...we were too hungry to wait for the gal to come around. For the entrees, We had our Thai staples - pad see ew and yellow curry. As always, I added baby corn. The noodle dish was good, however not the best. The Chinese broccoli was a bit too bitter and the flavor was a bit mum -- old nonetheless. The yellow curry - packed with yummy veggies and tofu, was a bit underwhelming. It was also had a tinge of sourness that we didn't enjoy. Could've been our tastebuds a bit off kilter.   Staff was friendly, space was cozy, prices decent. We may or may not visit again, but had a fair experience the first time around.

Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States

yCZpERgXrWczDR0XmxPcGg.text: That is some pretty tasty thai food! I went here last night, service was pretty quick and food was good. I ordered the pumpkin curry, it was tasty. I asked for mild though and there was kind of no spice at all. Usually I play it safe at Thai places and order mild, but I wish this would've had a touch more kick to it. The vegetables, tofu, and pumpkin were just right though! Also I usually kind of plow through rice at thai places, but I had quite a bit left over here which was good. The fish tank with fake fish was a little tacky but also entertaining haha. Prices seemed pretty normal for a thai place like this. I'd come back here!

_qkOvWXCOK9PwfvWOhau5w.text: The potstickers were ok. I thought the crab Rangoon's were not great though. I was just unimpressed by most the food here.

4GCRop-NuYteCFhdD6Cmxw.text: Sala Thai has been my family's favorite Thai food in the valley for years! The curry, soup, and appetizers are a must have! My personal favorites are green curry, pumpkin curry, hot and sour soup, suki-Yaki soup, phad Thai, clear noodle salad, and sweet bbq sausage. I've also been told the cashew chicken is amazing.

hthpF1s3byPWmvCKYv7FGg.text: Surprised. Stopped at this place on a whim since we were not in our normal neighborhood. I had just had a small surgery and was leaving the Dr. so decided to get it togo. We had crab wontons, spicy coconut soup (no protein), BBQ pork, and roasted duck. The crab wontons are my husbands favorite takeout order and these ones were even more amazing for him because they had no onions (he hates onions). We were both surprised about how this random find turned out to be the best Thai food we have had in Phx (that wasn't homemade from our friends from Thailand). And we had plenty for left overs so we could enjoy it all over again. Healthy portion of rice came with. If you are anywhere near this place, or not, make the drive... it's worth it.

yT5TVhNFv3LnjgROWC7zcQ.text: The place was nice for a family owned business. Servers are excellent you can really tell  they are doing a job well done for the fact the place was very busy. Food was amazing ! The amount of serving was a ver decent portion .. plus theres a bowl of rice ! .. its not a fine dinning ! So people don't expect to much .. all in all we are definitely coming back !!

o9Ozq5UJk2psLhFoqE_GqQ.text: Great food and service. Good parking. Use same ingredients as in Thailand so you get a taste of The Land of Smiles.

a7mvoWNZMWUZzlLv1EUlZQ.text: Food is good but service can be just ok..depends on wait person. I would recommend people to try it.

GIQy2Iw0xoqR6DYCzHiCgA.text: Absolutely love love love love love this place soooooooo much. I get so happy after eating the full serving of red chicken curry along with some of my girlfriends serving. I cannot have enough of this place. If I forced to only eat from one restaurant for the rest of my life it would honestly be this place. I would give a 6th star if I could but I can't

0XjMzgBVP6w6mqBBVoehFw.text: Thai restaurants are always interesting because of the varying spice levels. First time trying any place, I try to go conservative because I don't want to necessarily ruin my meal with uber spice.   Let me tell ya, this place does spice/heat right. Just the way I like it. My first time eating here, I got level 4 out of 5, and it was perfect. My daughter got 3 and I tried her noodles, which were spicy still..   Service. Well, as others have mentioned, it's not the most warm and fuzzy service you will get, but will suffice. The food makes up for it.   Portions are smaller here, so you won't feel stuffed nor will an average person have leftovers. My 8 year old was able to finish his plate with no problem.   I noticed on their credit card bill, the preprinted recommended tip only goes up to 15%, whereas usually at other restaurants I see it go at a minimum to 20%.

YEQdSnwIFXkY41HWLg4GXQ.text: My boyfriend took me here to try curry for the first time and I was satisfied! The red chicken curry was delicious. The serving was pretty large and good for the price! The atmosphere is very nice too. It's my boyfriends new fav place, and that says A LOT!

E95DPEXr3F4jOvvu7v97XA.text: The best Thai food I've had here so far!!  I tried the Pa-nang curry which was amazing!

EVGjbTLVvfzp7wgbrH0Q1A.text: Pineapple fried rice was delicious! Very reasonably priced and Thai ice tea was great!

2TKIeZgkyP3VmtA0cqEQKg.text: Absolutely amazing selection of food. And they get the spiciness right when they ask you. I would highly recommend this place. Very hard to find good Thai food.
