Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut milk soup and crab wontons. They definitely do not skip on the filling

j9Tf8r71WZ-HTomjl_2L-A.text: The best Thai Food in town! Been eating here and their other locations since 2008. Currys are to die for. Favorite fried rice is their pineapple fried rice. As far as their phad thai, hands down one of the best!

NRhReBA8tqzG6srWjean1Q.text: 3 stars for an average of food (5/5) and service (2/5).  Service is always slow and hit/miss.  It is hard to get condiments and beverage refills because nobody comes and checks on you often and you are left sitting for a while after your meal ends waiting for service to get the check.  Ordering takeout often reduces the portion size and makes the food dry with little sauce for some reason.  Food can't be beat though!

nJJ5sEO-Q6NMrNKoyl04Yg.text: I have only dined in here once, but every time I have done to-go orders, it has been correct and delicious. I always get the pumpkin curry or the clear noodle soup without chicken because I am vegan! The pad Thai is also amazing even though the do not use the thin noodle traditionally used in such a dish. It is great to get in the winter time to warm you up! I, overall, have been very satisfied with this restaurant.

Kxl9ulVmIdxMCIvmjSMrow.text: Most Thai in northwest valley really don't know Thai and Sala Thai is the perfect example of that. If you are from a "big city" and KNOW good Thai, this is not for you. The restaurant was overwhelmed on a Thursday night and might be the reason for flavorless fare, but I think this is the best this restaurant can do.

49yXp0UixPh5gze08qb69A.text: Went here for drunken noodles and pineapple fried rice and both were mediocre.  The rice was basically from a bag with added pineapples from a can without any added spices or curry. The drunken noodles were decent but not nearly enough basil. I will say the spring rolls were good but that's just rolled vegetables...

6w4BSzyw8yWJEgIZu4zrEw.text: Friendly service with flavorful food. Not from the area, traveling for business. Stopped here and was not disappointed.   Fresh papaya salad and the coconut shrimp was not greasy.

photos.caption: Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States

UY9jaw5459oVgHE2B-lIyw.text: Unbelievable!! Best Thai I've had in a long time, by far the best in the valley. Massuman Curry and the Phad Thai were amazing. Quiet atmosphere, courteous staff, lovely restaurant  to enjoy a meal. Would recommend!!

5wlllL7rNzoz-89uBqGNSA.text: My husband and I initially judge any Thai restaurant on the Tom Kra Gai (spicy chicken coconut soup).  If they don't have it, we don't return.  If they have it, but it's only average, we don't return.  If it's fabulous we become customers for life.  Sala Thai has the best Tom Kra Gai we have found in Arizona.  We purchase take-out from here regularly and have never had a bad meal.  Some of the stand out dishes include Larb Salad, Angel Wings, Thai BBQ Sausages, Spicy Basil Fried Rice, and Pumpkin Curry.    Fresh?  Check. Authentic?  Check. Thai spicy as opposed to American spicy?  Check. Freaking delicious?  Check!

TfaYdHZBBEZ-d8THIoqs2g.text: This is one of my and my husband's favorite restaurants in town. Every time we take someone there, they love it, too! And every time we try something new, it's better than the last thing. I typically get the Pad Thai, and my husband's fave is the Phad-See-Ew. I'm also a big fan of both the red and the green curry. You really can't go wrong here.  They expanded maybe a year ago, so it's been updated a little, but the place is still small and doesn't look like much from the street (or the strip mall it's' in). Still, the service is always good and fast, and it's BYOB. Don't miss this hidden gem!  PS. I like spicy, but a 2 ther (on a scale of 1-5) is still pretty hot.

-8k1ps7LYgHOIvSJrAVlKA.text: I've lived in the neighborhood for 11 years and I love Thai food. However, I was reminded why I've stayed away from here for the past three years. I ordered the special today; lettuce wraps with chicken. The lettuce was the best part. The chicken had good flavor, too. But there was barely a quarter cup of it. This dish was mostly comprised of noodles!, large chunks of onion and white button mushroom, and bland tofu. It had a side of three sauces, all loaded with sugar. For a much better Thai lettuce wrap, I highly recommend Pei Wei, believe it or not!

1Jbg78cmo4JYaUu7jhXMPA.text: I went to this restaurant for lunch. The service was good with friendly staff but slow. The food - my kids had Pad See Ew which was a small portion, too much other stuff like veges or meat but not enough noodles. My curry was good but every bite of the pork had gristle or chewy fat and it turned me off for eating more. Captain rolls were great. Overall, it is a decent place to eat Thai food but it wouldn't be my first choice.

nzag9Wy8mxWPAn4xeAHPIQ.text: Perfect Thai food and great for take out or dine in. I love the drunken noodles and panang curry.

hUGFpKd4TQWLFzx1gc0nGA.text: Decent noodle/rice dishes, but the real star of their menu are the curries! They have some lovely and varied curries throughout the year (pumpkin, eggplant) that really have a host of complex, lovely flavors.  I'd highly recommend them!    Plus, there's a cool fish tank with plastic fish zooming around inside.

VUT3tKHHjkYKiuv4DjFI0g.text: Great food and friendly service.  Love their coconut boba drinks!!  I've only eaten to-go from here, but the portions were large and delicious.  I am definitely making this my new go-to Thai restaurant.

kqqLeAOuobYNAgNN6a6isA.text: Best spring rolls I've found in the greater Phoenix area.

0YBgXxUQZ3o68RQFeGq0Dg.text: This is a really solid great neighborhood thai restaurant. I always gauge a Thai place by their panang curry and theirs is awesome.  We ordered spice level 2 out of five and it was just right in spiciness.  It had a good heat but not too much.

sUwwjiVN5TNKwQqz72-K7Q.text: Yummy!! I highly recommend the curries! Red, yellow, green, we had all 3 today (take-out, ate at home with unexpected dinner guests) and will definitely eat here as regulars. The portions are big enough to share, or not! The ingredients are fresh. The staff is very nice, over the phone and in person. The place is clean and low key, dress up or down, just go there!

emzPhVvIo5nrkTzHEweMqA.text: Favorite Thai restaurant, love love love the Pad Thai dish. Great food, great service, great price. You can choose how spicy you want your food and most dishes are large enough to split :)

HJAlV1_tzoPd3dZHPSTrkA.text: I've given this restaurant 3 stars because I have now tried both locations, and BOY is there a big difference.  I've eaten at the Phoenix location twice; once for take-out and once to dine in.  Their food is quite good.  I found the quality of the curry and soups to be consistent.  The dishes were well prepared and very tasty.  The service in Phoenix was ok.  It can be a bit difficult to communicate, but not impossible.  Phoenix earns a 4.  Goodyear is an entirely different experience.  I stopped there for lunch recently and was very surprised at the difference.  The young man serving tables was rather clueless.  He did not take orders correctly, missed items ordered, took dishes to the wrong tables, and loudly complained about the kitchen staff to customers.  It was AWFUL!  I wish I could send an email to management, but all they have on their website is phone numbers, and if I called I could end up talking to the person that gave us such a bad experience.  The food was not up to par, and Sala should be embarassed at the 'service'.  This location should get 1 star, but I will give them the benefit of the doubt that this was an isolated incident as I have only been to that location once.  Highly doubt I would try it again.

NwhNrnxSON1yUMQd9HwtTQ.text: I live nearby and take out twice a month. I love it and my fe Fiends do, too. So, I keep coming back. I enjoy pad Thai red or yellow curry, and their vegetable dishes. Very reasonable price. Very authentic Thai

IQYuMbuWr7rzgGqgNQOjgA.text: Went here for dinner, ordered Pad Thai, Drunken Noodles and Penang Curry. Worst Pad Thai ever, even the vegetables were raw in the curry. Never again.

rMMOCQJYylGG_Pz3k67cRg.text: It's hard to go wrong with Thai food. We did carry out and had red curry tofu and pad se ew. They forgot to give me brown rice, but the food was otherwise good. Cute little restaurant, I'll have to try dining in sometime.

5a1K4agV0nnjpb-9mTZM_Q.text: I'm a fan.  I've traveled to Thailand and the staff is generally helpful in making recipes less authentic.  I keep forgetting NOT to order vegetarian pad thai.  Broccoli doesn't belong in that dish!  Other things are great.  My favorites are larb, fish cakes, and pumpkin curry.  My mother most loved duck red curry.  Everything is accurate level of spiciness.  Dine in or take out, it's a safe bet.

5G621pkiYsnjvpafu3u38Q.text: I love the food, but the service is been terrible lately especially carry out. I called in an order they said 15-20 minutes. We showed up at 30 minutes and they said ten more minutes. I sat and waited as they were really busy. Almost 30 more minutes and asking multiple times the order was ready. They didn't really seem apologetic. Not sure what is going on, but makes me think twice about coming back.

c14dfQx_Ybk-p57pl58tpw.text: This is hands down my favorite little hole in the wall restaurant in town!  Sometimes the service is slow but the food is consistently fresh and delicious!  I live on the west side and this place is 100% worth the drive.  The panang or pumpkin curries are my favorite.

_0gm8VuAmqYSZrAF2Pn28g.text: Awesome Thai food! I had the Pad Thai Anne it was incredible. We had the spring rolls for an appetizer. They were delicious the veggies were fresh and the dipping sauce was sweet and tangy. My wife had the coconut milk soup and it was very enjoyable.

5WRWUxxUaAODLXFkvNZhKw.text: Food was excellent.  Hot and sour soup was amazing.  Waitress was new so need to cut her a break.  Service is normally really good.

qJN5Q0GKCR3bwsQXRFqiUA.text: If you're going to Sala Thai on a Sunday and meeting other people you would do well to remember that there is light traffic on Sunday and you will get here early.  If you get here early, there is a Big Lots down the street where you can spend a few minutes soaking up an almost permeable seedy feeling.  Or not.  I would opt for not.  Or you can do what our dinner partners did and visit a dive bar for a drink.  It's just as well because Sala Thai does not serve alcohol.  I'm looking forward to the review on that one, Christine.  No pressure.  I was excited to try Sala Thai after seeing numerous strong reviews.  Overall, they did not disappoint.  We started with pork satay.  We had not seen satay offered in pork.  This was the least satisfying of the selections we had.  The pork was a little chewy and the yellow curry just didn't seem to go well with the pork.  We all shared four entrees.  We had spicy basil fried rice which was delightful and probably my favorite item overall.  I am hoping to have that again soon.  It had a nice balance of spice and fresh basil that was refreshing.  The catfish with panang curry was very nice.  It was the largest catfish fillet I have seen, cooked quickly so as to sear it lightly and some crispiness on the outside while remaining moist and tender inside.  It was heavily sauced and we ordered 4 out of 5 on the spiciness scale.  I think everyone at the table fought off a reflexive sneeze with the first bite of that one.  I would like to see how hot the 5 is, but keep in mind the 4 is pretty hot.  We also had pad thai which for me is a bit of a benchmark dish.  Sala Thai's was unique and very good.  Not overly sweet and with just the faintest hint of smokiness in the pepper flavor, rather complex for pad thai.  Rounding out the tour de Sala Thai was a duck curry with coconut milk, red chili paste, pineapple, basil, tomato and onion.  I'm not a fan of duck but this was very good.  I had several pieces of the duck and plenty of the sauce ladled over my steamed rice.  I recommend Sala Thai.  The sauces were so flavorful that Myles M and I mortified Christine O and Audrey W by licking clean every serving dish on the table.  Not really, but it was close.

PuOjwXvwsF_uVl3S6_BBOQ.text: I found a good one!  Thanks to the reviews from Josh and Megan, I remembered Sala Thai Restaurant when I was craving thai food for dinner last night.  I wanted to try something new and it worked out well because Sala is located not too far from REI where I was headed to do some holiday shopping.  Sala provided me with a pleasantly full belly and fueled me for my shopping.  When I pulled into the parking lot, Sala was easy to see thanks to the fact that their lighting inside is extremely bright.  They are located next door to a martial arts studio and I could hear the people over there doing their thing a couple of times during my dinner... not necessarily distracting, but enough to make other yelpers aware of!  A friendly thai woman welcomed me when I walked in and told me to sit down where ever I wanted... I took note of her authentic fuschia thai outfit and was pleased with the fact that she followed me over to clean the table thoroughly before I sat down.  As I waited, I took note of some of the thai artwork on the walls and some letters from children - thanking the people at Sala for a 'cultural experience.'  I assumed from this that Sala had hosted some kind of dinner for elementary students and their families; very cool.  The menu is extensive and I had a hard time deciding what to order... everything looked really good!  There were several items that I had never seen on a thai menu before such as several entrees with pumpkin and a thai omelet.  That is the problem with dining solo at a thai restaurant - you don't get to share and try different dishes.  I enjoyed looking at the menu and the pictures of select dishes as well.  Please note - Sala Thai does not serve alcohol.  They do offer fresh fruit thai mocktails and thai iced coffee and tea.    After much debate, I went with #10 to start - Thai Salad with Peanut Sauce and #84 - Spicy Eggplant with Shrimp.  I was really happy with the salad; It tasted fresh and included lettuce, tomato, cucumber, carrots, onions, and red peppers.  The peanut Sauce was served on the side and it was sweet, creamy, and the perfect sauce to compliment the salad.  I ordered the Eggplant with 'medium' spice.  This was plenty!  I tend to like spice, but next time I may even order mild-medium.  I was happy they served me plenty of white rice to balance the spice of the dish...  Serving sizes were generous and I had leftovers to take home.  I cannot wait to return and try some of the other menu items as well.  This is the perfect place to go on a weeknight if you're in the mood for a casual thai dinner.  Next time, however, I'm bringing friends!

KUS3YIVgQZEYkUeUTi0XkQ.text: Just had dinner overall ok place solid 3 stars, flavored are not very sophisticated, just moved to the area and decided to try the place. Service was prompt and people were nice. I hope I am not too hard on them but I have had Thai @ other places, with more richer flavors. I may give it another chance and try other dishes. Btw prices are very reasonable.

xfbx_HD3XuWmUeQi0c_dQw.text: SO GOOD! The pumpkin curry is the bomb. Everything was yummy and so affordable. The portions are great. The atmosphere is quirky but fun. The tank full of fake fish is fun to gaze at.

PltpJ_N4APWShl4NvY0pXw.text: I have been here a bunch and have not yelped this place...I think it is time i do right by them because they do right for my stomach.   The rushes here are really random so make sure you give them a call and see how busy they are. If they are busy i would say hold off on going for a little bit. They expanded their restaurant, but the kitchen is the same size and cannot efficiently handle a packed restaurant.   I really recommend getting the fried catfish curry, that literally is the best thing on the menu hands down. I love it soo much. I can't not get this when i go.  I enjoy all their spicy food to rate it a 1 is like peppercorn spice, 3-4 is a mild jalapeno  and 5 is around a spicy jalapeno and serano.   Service is always been good, everyone is polite. The only time when service is slow/bad when the place is getting packed.   This place is where i go when i crave some thai food for sure.

ZBhAOqoPV8PnFHectS8PKw.text: Unassuming little restaurant from the outside, but lovely and traditional inside. Wonderful food, great service, nice atmosphere. Had the fish cakes,  cream puffs and the beef mussuman.  All were perfect.  Quick tip if you're from southeast Asia or Australia: ask for at least 4 out of 5 on the spicy scale.  Highly recommend.

ATJohfXq_Ot1AajO9s5xYg.text: We come here once a blue moon when I'm visiting friends in N. Phx.  Usually we do family style so I get to taste everyone's order.  On this visit, majority of our dishes were overly salty and we just assume they may have a new chef.  At the end of dinner, our waitress came around and asked we want to pack up our 1/2 eaten dishes. I told her no because it way too salty.  Since I wasn't sure if it's just a one time thing, I asked if they have a new chef.  She said no and pretty much did nothing about it.  Crap, not sure if I'm willing to risk another salty dinner again.  Lad Na, Red & Yellow Curries (2*) - super salty & cannot finish Thai BBQ Spare Ribs (1*) - dry & super tough Pineapple Rice Rice (3*) Tom Yum w/ chicken (4*)

jpfc3_3hRhIo25C9vGqCGQ.text: Our favorite neighborhood stop. Great value, food is always fresh, staff is always friendly. Get the spring rolls!

htLSrqGwhkHHewGcfHw_Rw.text: The beef salad was authentic and delicious. Everything I order at this place is amazing. Don't be fooled by the fish curtains this place is the real deal.

X7NacQ8Vi_-pz7gVSWnLMw.text: Pad Thai! Been going here for years, although not often enough in the past 5 years since we moved up north around Desert Ridge.   I will warn you, the service and food delivery is SLOW. So, don't come here if you are in a hurry.

qCSr3f95x_-uTLFoA91zoA.text: I'll keep it simple. For a strip mall Asian restaurant it doesn't get any better, especially in and around this part of Phoenix. My go to favs are Pad-Thai, cashew chicken, and pot stickers. My 4yr old nephew has been known to eat 10 of their potstickers, they are that good.

_RTtVl36-CimaKY2RTFzow.text: The tom kra gai was tasty as was the pad thai. Service good too. My first time here & I will be back!!!

sDT4RK4IZRwCTVSr-u_40w.text: We had takeout tonight.   . My wife had the Pad Thai, and it was tasteless.  I had a cashew with shrimp dish with 6 hotness but it wasn't very hot at all(They have a hotness scale of 1-5, so they should have known I was looking for something very spicy.)  Krua Thai Cuisine restaurant is better.

ZPJzQgbgrWfKr46VGS4KcA.text: Food is terrible. Obviously not consistent. But the service is terrible. Young girls serving who are rude. No please no thank you and they slam our stuff down. I wot e back. Goodness this food is terrible!

zuyccqP7Aqog8vKi__Pv2A.text: Great food, one of the best green curry dishes I have ever had. The pad thai could be a little better but that's just being but picky.

BaSWGmUsCgorC1XKg4ESaQ.text: I have been coming here since 2007. This place has received so much business that they expanded within the last year by purchasing the open space next door. Their food is hot, fresh, and clean. Their service is top notch and they really care about the customer. I HIGHLY recommend their establishment.

rg2CLDvV5xTilwDGtnBdxA.text: This place is definitely quite a ways outside downtown Phoenix.  The place is pretty small and does not accommodate large parties, but they adjusted the seating for us.  Some of the dishes we ordered were the beef larb, tom yum seafood soup, curry shrimp, curry chicken, a chicken noodle dish and another seafood dish.  All were pretty average and nothing to rave about.  They did have quite a variety of blended drinks and the coconut banana was pretty good.  The banana flavor was strong taking away from the coconut.

_xhnRdwQwusH2BhuMiYSHQ.text: We went here last night for dinner and once again had an amazing meal! Even on Sunday night this place was packed. The service is always friendly and the food is delicious!  Now that the weather is getting chilly I don't think there is anything more satisfying then spicy thai food.  We usually get the red curry with seafood and the drunken noodles but it seemed like everyone around us was having one of the soups (either Tom Yum or Tom Kra Gai). They looked good so next time we will try one of those.

CemJy9sQxHr-GFYkY1K_LA.text: Delicious Thai food! I order takeout here all the time and it never fails to disappoint. Order medium spicy unless you really like to feel the burn! Pa nang curry is delicious, spicy basil fried rice and spicy green bean beef. Love the tom yum soup as well!

p2Wehh47Oh62x7kmJWkexw.text: Best Thai Food in Phoenix. The service is great. The food is ON POINT. I highly suggest going here.

hYE4EtlUyvR1Q7GHzic1mA.text: I've been ordering from this place for almost a decade now and it's always been amazing. But we ordered recently and everything was TERRIBLE. The beef was so burnt it was inedible. The curry had no flavor, my coconut soup tasted sour(not in a good way it tasted like the coconut milk was old and spoiled).  Called and complained and they refused to compensate for anything and even admitted they had a new cook training that night!! They will never get my business again for how they handled it. No refund and told me a manager would call me and I never got a phone call.   Go to Thai House on Shea they will never disappoint. Thai House is 100% better than Sala Thai ever wishes they could be.

EjqDD_kPutKGf0Tmsl8bRQ.text: I'm not really sure how to rate this. The food is good but the portions are small for the price. What grossed me out was when I asked for rice the waitress grabbed the rice that was served to the couple that was about to leave and served it on our table. I was shocked and looked at the couple. The lady said it's okay and that they didn't touch it.  I told her that is not the point.  We did not eat the rice, also did not feel well after. I don't think we will be coming back, not sure what other food they reuse.

F4J-IRvulM4_JcO55pNhVQ.text: I will never forget my dining experience at Sala Thai. The staff are friendly and attentive. The food is fresh, flavorful, and delicious. We Ordered the pineapple shrimp curry, Pad See-ew, and fresh shrimp spring rolls. We'll definitely be coming back again.   - Steven, age 10   Jr. Foodie

TxzZhzx8zjAJT_8O7b5JGQ.text: Disappointed.  Came here on a recommendation that it was the best thai. It was lackluster at best. My green curry was bland, no spice, watery and contained a frozen vegetable blend of green beans and peas and carrots. I will keep looking for good thai near me. This certainly does not fit the bill. Frozen vegetables  and peas and carrots in green curry...seriously???

1lQCs1p905qCpoSp03NAwg.text: Piss poor service! AND  horrible food!  First of all when you walk in the front door- the door was sooo dirty and grimy- gummy- it was so gross. We debated as to weather we should actually go in. When we got inside- it looked clean enough yet there was a weird "dirty" smell wafting through the door.  The food might have been just ok- but by the time we actually got it- we were so frustrated we didn't care.   The place wasn't  busy- yet we waited 10 minutes for the server to take our order. She acted like we really screwed up her day by coming in. On top of it- she was a mumbler. Couldn't understand a damn thing she said. We finally ordered the Thai Basil Leaves, Pumpkin Curry with Brown Rice, and the Fresh Spring Rolls to start.  47 minutes later...after others who came in after us were already served and done---  All the food came out together including the starter. Minus the brown rice.  So we started with the Fresh Rolls. They were bland- no basil. By the time we got to the entrees- they were of course cold. Still no brown rice. The server still did not check to see how we were. We finally motioned to her and she said she was busy- and would get it. Busy? WTF?  5 minutes later... we were able to grab the guy who was serving other tables and asked for the rice.  The food was bland and tasteless. And it all had the same flavor- except for the Basil dish. The tofu was burned- see picture. So the whole dish tasted burned. Yuck.  The server never came back to check on us- until she brought the bill. We showed her the tofu- and she said well we have a new chef. My companion said- thats not my problem, I am the customer."  The server took the bill back and spoke to the manager supposedly- she came back with 10 percent off the bill. Again WTF! 10 percent is - I guess-is something- but certainly didn't make up for the dumbass server-who tried to blame everything on someone else.   I will never be back- This is one dump!

photos.caption: Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NqmWCV0FKiecdN1B3EyiVA.text: Food was quick and great! Environment was fun. Spicy is SPICY! What more do you want?

TLhTwmYD3b5PIl-ccLN-Cw.text: I have been to Sala Thai many many times. They have always provided wonderful service with exceptional food. Keep in mind, this restaurant is a family owned business; therefore, it has the charm and friendliness of that familial feel. I love the personalities of the staff  and the decor of this restaurant. The staff here are very considerate and pays close attention to your needs as a customer.    Remember they know how Thai food is done. This isn't some corporate chain business or formulated menu that they factory out; the food here tastes AUTHENTIC. Each dish is uniquely created with the appropriate flair of the Thai culture.   I have never had issues communicating or expressing what I want or would like with the staff.   I ordered the tom yum, green curry, fried catfish, phad thai, drunken noodles and even a few of their desserts before. These dishes are all magical.  The tom yum was just the right sour flavor and the herbs really bring out the aroma of this dish. I highly suggest starting off with this savory soup.  Drunken noodles has to be one of my favorites at this restaurant. You can never go wrong with this choice as it brings a variant burst of aromatic flavors. If I order really high level spicy food, I always order a thai tea to go with it. Fun Fact: The milky flavors of this sweet and refreshing beverage actually conteracts the spice flavors. Another great way to enjoy this cuisine; why not blend the flavors?  I can honestly say I will continue to come back again and again; I will even bring friends as I have in the past. Sala Thai has won me over with their delicious authentic dishes, friendly staff and charming atmosphere.   OH and they do take out too!

fE18Rn55PKNoRZl8RghhgA.text: I had the red curry (#4 hot). It was so so good. If your trying to make a decision about what thai place to eat at. This is a good choice.

qT1ztYlWspsTCWEAJX-Q1g.text: This place has gone downhill.  I am a regular customer but for the last few visits their service is horrible.  During our last visit, we were missing a couple of items and they didn't even care.  By the time it came out; everyone at the table was done eating.  The wait staff didn't even check if we needed refills.  They were too busy talking.  It's not like they were busy.  They only had 3 tables.  Food is good but expensive since portions are too small.  Definitely do not recommend and will not come back.

CVnoaMspszdmO1BGfrD2Pg.text: Legit Thai food. Great neighborhood spot. We've tried other Thai places nearby and this has been the best. Great curries,soups, and apps.   They just need delivery!  But great for take out and dining in.

RfJq4qm-jSCOYIOJpvTWWA.text: Was a great Thai restaurant then everything changed..now even more changes for the worst... Rap music playing while you try to eat ..not the same recipes or cooks.. Will not eat there anymore

FdHMfGLHf4ZPXroxulx9EA.text: I've been here a few times and usually it's much better...in fact, I rave about their veggie Pad Thai and coconut soup.  But I went last night and my order wasn't what I was used to.  My Pad Thai was lacking much flavor, strangely sweet, and it didn't come w the peanuts or lemon (they usually serve w lemon).  It definitely needed the missing crunch and acidity!!  The coconut soup was as good as ever!  We also order orange chicken, but were served orange shrimp...not bad, just not what we were expecting.    Overall, I will definitely go back but a little disappointed w last night's showing

photos.caption: Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut chicken soup; delish!
Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Where&#39;s the peanuts and lemon?!  Veggie Pad Thai

GUF8xW57HHoDeID6gQXpPA.text: Another quick, decent Thai place, located in a strip mall, Sala Thai seems like a neighborhood spot that you go to when you don't want to drive far - it wasn't bad but I wouldn't  go out of my way to eat here.  All the food we tried was pretty good except for the green curry, which had an odd flavor that I couldn't quite put my finger on. It tasted grassy or more medicinal than typical green curry and it was quite watery. We didn't eat much of that, but the veggie fried rice, pad kee mao, eggplant stir fry, Tom yum soup and papaya salad were all okay. The serving portions were very generous and prices are fair. Service was very quick and while our server was a bit forgetful he was friendly and easygoing when we had to remind him about our requests.   I liked the aquarium tank filled with plastic fish. It was a cute, homey touch and honestly more entertaining to watch than real fish.   For dessert, we tried the coconut ice cream, which was a struggle to share, because it was so good. The mango sticky rice on the other hand had rice so hard that it was unpleasant to eat - it felt like it had been left out overnight without being covered. On the other hand, the mango on the rice was perfectly ripe and went well with the ice cream.   Overall, it was a decent Thai dinner, but because of the curry and sticky rice being off, I'm leaving three stars for now.

BXJ06M0e0XUJn7417Ihq3g.text: Love this place! I live in Gilbert, but if I'm ever down this way, I head here for amazing Thai food! I've had the Panang Curry with chicken, the Garlic Chicken (stays crispy even with sauce!), the Thai Beef Salad, and the Spicy Green Beans. All of them have been delicious! The Thai teas are great too. Last time we came, the owner gave us free samples of the Mango Sticky Rice. Perfect dessert to end the meal. Can't go wrong with anything here!

photos.caption: Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy Green Beans with chicken and Thai Tea
Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Panang Curry with chicken

c5r-YlwfbaaUdSnmaIlIgg.text: Yummy yummy yummy!! We always order to go, and absolutely love the thai tea, the drunken noodle and all of the curry dishes!! Fantastic every time!!

Ft_rX5ngJIB10kb4EMIPnA.text: It says the restaurant is open until 9 pm, yet when I called to order to go at 8:43 pm I was told kitchen is closed. If it says you are open until 9 pm you should take orders until 9 pm. In addition to food quality there is consistency and accountability that gusts count on.

6fdg2r0DlCnHkPwzhLyavw.text: Good food, decent price. Coconut shrimp, Coconut milk soup and sticky rice-mango dessert are great

I02cHYlXbA6ZcIVHWnTEVw.text: The first time I went, with friends who knew the owners, the food was great and the service too. The next time less so. The third time, one in our party ordered a dish that wasn't delivered until we were all finished with our meals, and after considerable checking and prodding. Recently we decided to give them one more try when a friend from out of the country was with us. The service was marginal, the food mediocre and once again the meal our foreign friend ordered didn't show up until we complained three times and were finished with our food. The shrimp dish finally showed, was undercooked and lacked any real flavor.   I complained to the guy, is he the owner, manager, head waiter? Hard to say. Just the guy, he said he was sorry and went onto explain that a lot of "to-go' orders had slowed the BBQ dishes. Like, I guess they can't tell people who are not there that the food will take 30 minutes instead of 20? Whatever. He said he'd discount the final (uneaten) dish and when we went to leave he said he would normally discount the single dish by 10% but that because there was a computer problem, he could only do 5%. Seriously, 5%. I told "The guy" this was it for me, he'd lost my business, he said he was sorry, but not making things right for customers is not the way to earn business.  I've really wanted to love this place. It's close to my house and initially the food was good. But the service is dismal at best, and always disorganized. The food is also always inconsistent. Did I mention I saw them cleaning the tables with Pine Sol? Probably not so good to eat anything you drop onto the table...All done here. I won't be back. Not ever. Think twice, there is a lot of good Thai in town.

7yGy5006iezmqnGA-AygIQ.text: I think it's one of the best Thai food in Phoenix. The other one is Glai Baan.  Very flavorful food, tasteful ambience, chill setting for a very good meal at reasonable rates.

sqMPI8pO-qiLtMxiMlduuw.text: Got mine to go, quick service.  Spicy basil fried rice: tasty but it had these star shaped carrots that I could've done without. Got number 3 medium spicy, and it was spicier than I expected but I loved it.  Drunken noodle: also had these random star shaped carrots again. Otherwise it was great. Good portions.  Tip: Make sure they give you utensils and chili sauce if you order to go!

RT3d4cMhOh099c5I0sctiA.text: On my quest to find acceptable ethnic dishes in my new neighborhood , I came across this restaurant while searching yelp for a decent Thai place. (Please keep in mind, I'm a bit of a Thai food addict, being from NYC and all).  We ordered an assortment of dishes for takeout one night (Pad Thai, Spring Rolls, Wings, and Ginger Beef), all of which was tasty and hot.  Would definitely come back and eat in, or order take out from again.

clx-WxQ1lo3WknzsPfCPuQ.text: Any place that closes their table service early is not running a fair establishment.  Walked in at 8:45PM tonight and they stated "take out only."  I really should give only two stars as the last meal had overcooked pad Thai noodles, but the rest of their dishes are very good.  Spotty service; good food.  Oh well!

tAnTK9evMr1TIy4K1W53ow.text: A friend recommended this place to me. The atmosphere is good. Food is delicious and I would recommend the duck curry. The service is very nice they are always looking after the customer, making sure everything is alright. Good job friend on this pick.

MUVd6XBINXuKAW2fow4bNw.text: This was so great and local! The food was creative and fantastic and very authentic and the prices very very reasonable. I will be back!

PnhiTclubUAZuXjCi2sIYQ.text: This place is beyond delicious. Their mock tails are actually exactly like those boba bubble tea drinks and I can not get enough! There curries are good, egg rolls, everything I've tried was amazingly authentic. The only thing is I wish they delivered. Then it would be the perfect restaurant.

v_q0I9tvHe6V4XLeXYvgMA.text: New in the area and wanted to find a nice Thai restaurant. It was a Sunday afternoon but they seemed busy. The place is not big. The food was pretty good and no complains on the service. If I really have to be critical I would say the price is a little high for the quantity.

r2DdeLRN43C7f8p-8BZYPQ.text: Ah Sala Thai.. I've seen you grow from a newly opened awkward teenager to the busy mature establishment you are today. I'm lucky enough to live a few blocks from this place. I spotted it a week or so after it first opened and dragged a few friends there. I could tell and mentioned to the group that I knew this place would do well if they could stay a float and get the word out. Only wish I yelped back then so I could have been more help in the process.  When we ate there we were the only ones in the resturaunt. The kitchen at the time was manned soley by the grandmother and one of the daughters was taking orders and busing. Saturday we got in there to a packed house.. got the last open booth within 15 minutes a line formed out the door. The phone was ringing off the hook for pickup orders. The back area of the kitchen had 3 or 4 people in a mad rush turning out food. One of which was still the grandmother :) I was a little sad to see the prices jumped up and the portions went down but there was still plenty of food. The menu had also expanded largely.  What we were lucky enough to eat:  Thai Spring Rolls: Veggies wrapped up in a soft chewy rice wrapper served with a housin/peanut that would make shoe leather taste amazing. All the veggies were very fresh and crunchy which lent a great texture. The mint!! man do I love the fact that these have the crazy contrasting flavor of mint. Thai food is such a celebration of marrying sweet and savory flavors.  Fried Tofu: Quickest way to ruin something semi health is to batter and fry it :) but it is worth it. The crispy coating against the soft warm tofu is a great combination. Also served with that great plum/peanut sauce.  Tom Kha Gai: I've had this soup all over the country, various places in the UK and in New Zealand. Sala Thai and the little place in New Zealand have the best version so far. So spicy from the peppers, sweet from the coconut, intense ginger and lemon grass flavor. Just remembering this dish is what steered me here for my Saturday cheat meal. The soup is filled with large pieces of lemon grass and dried ginger so be cautious. You don't want to chomp down on either of these but I also wouldn't want them to leave it out.  Panang Chicken Curry: My absolute favorite dish of the evening. This curry is made from coconut cream instead of coconut milk. It lends an incredibly rich creamy smooth finish. You have sweet, spicy and creamy. What else could you want from a dish? I've only recently discovered my love for panang I used to do for red, yellow or green but glad I expanded my horizon.  Spicy Pumpkin Curry: This was my buddy Chris' pick. It was a red based curry with large chunks of pumpkin in it. There was a hint of pumpkin flavor but nothing to crazy and not a lot of sweetness. Now I do realize that in America we tend to sugar the heck out of anything with pumpkin but when in season, which we are at the tail end of, have a nice natural sweetness. I would venture to guess canned pumpkin was involved. Not a bad dish but far from my favorite.  Spicy Basil Fried Rice: Reading Jim W's review I decided to give this a try. It was very tasty. The texture of the rice was a bit mushy. The batch of steamed rice they used might have been a bit on the overdone side so the double cooking messed with the texture/consistency. Another great Thai marriage of flavors. Spicy from peppers, sweet from basil and richness from some peanut puree. Chris said it reminded him of pizza a bit, i looked at him funny. I took a few more bites and specifically one with a big piece of basil. I guess I could see it. There was some tomato flavor and the mixture of basil. Maybe a Thai pizza ;)  Pad Thai: Its not that I don't like Pad Thai. I'm just not usually one to order noodle dishes. My dad who is a well seasoned traveler loves this dish and has had it in more countries then I'll likely visit. Many places all over Asia and Thailand. He said this one was very good so I'll have to take his word on it. What I can say is that the noodles were done well. They were not mushy still had a nice bite to them.  Future Solo Meal: Thai Spring Rolls Tom Kha Gai Panang Chicken Curry  This was an A+ night.. with A+ food and B service. You can tell the girls were stressed and were doing the best they could so I can't get to upset at them. I tend to be much more understanding of under staffing at family run places. I would prefer them to run a bit slower then to hire people off the street who have nothing invested in the success of the place.  Pros: Great Food Friendly Staff Interesting Atmosphere  Cons: Slower Service When Busy Very limited seating. They have three tables and all the rest of them are 4 top booths. You are going to have a heck of a time with a group any larger then 4 at this place. They might be able to move a table and expand a booth to seat 7 but at dinner at a normal time your going to be waiting a long while for a booth and table to open up. Bit pricy for the portions

NKEXktVWZf6iQav1Lof-3w.text: I don't know what all the hype is about this place. I've tasted over 100 different Pad Thai dishes from various places and Sola Thai literally had the worst Pad Thai I've ever had. I'm willing to give them another chance on something else but if a Thai place can't make even decent Pad Thai thats not a good sign..

xHpz2riNhqFUyF9Z0ZWhlg.text: Catfish with panang is amazing. I've ordered it many times and I'm never disappointed. I've recommended this place to my friends and family. Its a great hidden gem.

_zBqi0wRv-xq_5oOjPrKcg.text: You wouldn't expect one of the best Thai restaurants in Phoenix to be located in a non-descript NoPho strip mall but it does. Sala Thai not only serves up quick, fresh, dependable and competitively priced Thai meals (which come out with a spice rating of 1 to 5 based on your heat tolerance ... 4 is plenty hot), but the servings are such that I always have enough leftovers to bring to work for lunch the next day. Great value. And I put a premium on value. One of the intangible qualities of Sala is that it's become somewhat of a community driver, a third space where you're as likely to run into a neighbor as you are to leave with a full and satisfied stomach.

sZMMNfHhCKssftF1gytDlA.text: Spring rolls, drunken noodles were delicious.  Pleasant decor, reasonable table service.  No complaints.  Recommended.

XCkI3JNS0H8hQA5eQlPMqw.text: Tasty Thai food!  The Rice soup is really good and great for sharing (enough for 4).  We had a bunch of appetizers and they were all good.  Our daughter loves the fried rice.  My favorite is the sticky rice & mango dessert.

HguKlZM0zVqQJqnpwxn5uw.text: When we want Thai food this is where we go.  Never disappointed.  Generous portions, fresh and delicious.  We have tried several items on the menu and everything is excellent.  Pad Thai and sweet Thai tea are my favorites.

yglNGgp39rWLiAAdRApDtA.text: Looking for some good Thai food I came across this restaurant.  I was quite impressed with this place.   Another restaurant located in a boring strip center, but what else is new for the Phoenix metro.  The decor is very appealing and the music playing in the background adds to the experience.  The service is great and helpful.  We all know we come for the food though.  Portions were just about the right size and full of the spicy flavors that I was looking for.  When I'm in the area I'll have to check this place out again and would recommend the restaurant to anyone who likes Thai food.

photos.caption: Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States

IkMDaXyGJnDB9ylOnXJMhg.text: I'm not gonna claim to be the professional on thai food but this place was delicious! The price was right, the room nice, and employees friendly.

lbJB8Uvj2pzM2aJgFrJlLg.text: I usually get the Pad Thai and spring rolls. The soups are fantastic and quite authentic but are huge portions. Not the prettiest setting but definitely some of the more authentic Thai food in the Phoenix area.

XK8HG2Y5wxrvMiUh7OCijg.text: Reviews here are very accurate, most of the food is very average, the PadThai here is terrible and the curry dishes use way too much fish salt, rendering them salty and overpowering.  The overall spicyness is very tame, and the food lacks the mints and fresh herbs you would expect from good Thai food.  On the bright side, the service is good and the food is cooked well, leaving the vegetables firm and tasty.  They have Angel Wings here, and while not handmade they are good. Fresh rolls are very dull, lacking the herbs necessary to bring any fragrance to the food.  There are many other Thai places in the area better than this, we would not go back.

AkEcoJBwAZJGUpp06jt4Tg.text: Absolutely the worst service ever. My food came out a full half hour before the other three folks at the table. so my meal was room temperature by the time my wife got hers. The other two meals crawled out an age later. So stupid! Tasted pleasant but so what!!!??? If I want to eat alone or in front of everyone I will stay home. Yack!

-rzw8h5_YgVuHxcTahhHvQ.text: By far the best Thai I've had in the valley. Sala Thai is a hidden gem. We go often and plan to continue to do so for as long as they are open.

ZD3IHQYtYHbkzttWgBUzOw.text: With a flight back to Minneapolis in 8 hours, we stopped by here for a quick dinner on a Sunday evening. I love Thai and was a bit concerned about the mixed reviews but wanted to try it for myself. It's in a little strip mall. It's not too crazy busy, seems like most of their business is take-out from our evening. The restaurant is clean and there is plenty of seating. The servers were younger, twin girls that were friendly. Our order was taken and our food was sitting in front of us within 10 minutes. Wow!   The Yellow Curry and Thai Fried Rice w/ Duck were delicious! We also got the mango with sticky rice for dessert. I don't see any issues with our food and it was very reasonably priced.   Only irritating thing was a group of about 7 people in a corner who were on their 5th bottle of wine and were VERY loud. They were more obnoxious than anything and the servers didn't do anything to calm them down - this is where they lost a star. Otherwise, it was a great meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yellow Curry
Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thai Fried Rice

n-7ywIs0gsCyUR6FePf0lw.text: I've been coming here for years. Food's always been good and they're fairly close. A bonus has been their BYO policy.   A couple of years ago they started adding a minimal $5 corkage fee for wine. OK, fair enough. But tonight we brought a partial bottle and I expected it. But I wanted a beer, so I brought a single beer, too. That wound up adding another $2.50 for just the beer. That's excessive. I paid $3.25 for a Kiltlifter in Payson earlier today.   Also, as others, have noticed smaller portions.   Will be rethinking my choices on local Thai restaurants.

i94_nPdvNiu0r-5VV-BGVQ.text: Good food NOT classic Thai  We live nearby and wanted to try a new place.  This place is small.  The best things are the service and price.  We were warmly greeted and promptly served.  We had spring rolls and chili wings on Happy Hour prices (basically $1 off regular price.  My wife had roast duck with vegetables and I had garlic snow peas with shrimp.  The sauces were unremarkable but there were LOTS of the Snow Peas.  Given the prices, it is a great value.

FBP8xESRXuzn2FBDmqLZEg.text: I hate to leave a negative review but I just have to be honest. My boyfriend and I came here for dinner. We love Thai food and we never really had bad experiences until we tried this place out.  When we entered this place, the waitress escorted us to our table and she told us that they had a party of 15 so she wanted to make sure that we order the food before they do, which was very nice of her telling us about it so we didn't have to wait too long for our food.   I looked at the menu and told my boyfriend that their price is definitely cheaper than other Thai restaurants we have gone so far. But what about their food? My boyfriend said, well... there's only one way to find out! Lol  I ordered Pad Thai with beef, spicy level mild. My boyfriend ordered their Pineapple Fried Rice, same spicy level. When the food came to us, the first thing we noticed was the portion is smaller than other Thai restaurants. Maybe that's why their price is cheaper. I tried my food and I was surprised because it tasted so... weird? For real though, I don't know if that's because they use a thinner noodle for their Pad Thai but I did not like it. And I know I ordered mild for the spicy level but I couldn't taste any spicy whatsoever at all. My boyfriend tried the Pineapple fried rice. There was no pineapple, therefore, it did not taste like Pineapple fried rice supposed to be.  We may come back to try other menu. I hope they can improve their food hopefully next time we will get a better experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pineapple Fried Rice
Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pad Thai

wr-DhRun3RKDs4UtD3CUMg.text: Sala Thai  We stopped in to this spot on a Saturday afternoon for lunch. We were a bit concerned over the mixed reviews but decided to give it a try. My wife loves Thai food (I do not) so here's what she had and her thoughts.  It's a small spot in a strip mall off 32nd st before Shea. The place appeared to be clean and the tables were ready to be used. The waitress told us to choose our own table / booth. The fish tank with fake plastic fish being pushed around by an electric motor circulating them an the water was different but no worries. We ordered in about 5-6 minutes and the food came out in less than 10 minutes.   Coconut Chicken Soup My wife was very excited about this dish. It has coconut milk, tomatoes, chicken, onions, mushrooms, cilantro, basil, a hint of lime & spices. The chicken was well cooked and not rubbery. The dish is definitely big enough for 2. This tasted like home. There was no need to provide extra seasoning and was very good just like it came. She easily gave this a two thumbs up. Grade: A  Veggie Thai Chow Mien  Broccoli, carrots, cabbage, bok choi, noodles and seasoning. She didn't need to add salt or anything else. She ate it just like it came. Her words were, "the flavors are spread out so well." She loved this dish as well. Grade: A   If you're looking for a very good Thai food restaurant and live in the area be sure to try this place. We will definitely be back (well... my wife will).

photos.caption: Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut Milk Soup
Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie Chow Mein

2IFVaI2tBnVsSbAnUCrepw.text: This place is really going downhill! When we first moved here and tried it we loved it! Now, it just seems like no one even cares! We sit there forever before even getting our drinks. We ordered a side of rice noodles instead of rice white rice with our meal and it came out cold and broken up in pieces as if it was used from someone else's plate. We told the waitress and she just looked at us and didn't respond. WILL NOT COME BACK!

KxBYMP6xeU42pPx_VImHQA.text: This spot is a hidden gem! It's been voted numerous times for best Thai food and it's very obvious why! I would have to highly recommend the pumpkin curry with chicken, talk about flavor explosion and especially right now for fall you can't go wrong. I typically share the pad Thai noodles and the curry and we both have plenty. The portions are fairly big, flavorful and most importantly, fresh! I love that you can choose the level of spice on your food as well! The inside is not very spacious with rather tight seating on one side, kitchen in the middle and booth seating on the other side. They do have a larger booth that could fit probably up to 6 people but I wouldn't suggest this place for larger groups. The only reason why I ranked it a 4 instead of a 5 was because the past few times I've been the service has been rather slow. Other than that the food keeps me coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0EhGx-KBQ1NStmQrinmYzw.text: This Thai restaurant truly needs to up their game. And they need to up their attitude from pour to service. From the start they had slow service and attitude to boot. Even when I said at the table my glass room was dirty with lipstick and the plates they served on the table for the spring rolls were already smeared & unclean.  Next, Nothing we ordered tasted right. My food was cold and BURNT, and my partners was COLD and raw.   We will never come back here as they gave us attitude when we tried to tell them that my partner's food was not cooked. I showed them that my food was actually burnt. And I was given an excuse that they had a new cook in the back. I don't think I've ever been to a restaurant where they wouldn't take it back or at least take it off the check. In fact, don't think I've ever even had burnt tofu in my entire life.   In sum, I felt the quality of this place did not deserve the justice of posting anything except poor poor service and poor poor food.

Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cold and undercooked.
Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ic0yRKIDH8b9j6CJdsXOsQ.text: We've been coming to this place since 2008, that's 11 years.  This past week I came here with several coworkers and... ALL 3 of us had stomach issues a little after lunch.  Then I realized last couple of times I ate seafood meals at this place in the last several months I had exactly the same stomach-churning symptoms, 1-2 hours after eating there.  And I've been eating fish and seafood for years, don't have any allergies to that cuisine whatsoever.  And I've had these exact meals at this place before without any issues.  Either expired food is being used to cook meals, or there is significant cross-contamination is happening in the kitchen - is my guess.  It's sad to post this, but I feel obligated to let others know.  Ownership has to figure out what's going on there.

K_5sF_Z04dRCsR8dnFbmvQ.text: 4 1/2 stars is what I'd really prefer to give with the only reason being that something we order can be amazing and just pretty good the next time.   Their prices and food overall are really too good to be True though and we go there about once a month.  If you desire an adult beverage in the restaurant, they don't serve them but have an inexpensive corkage fee so bring what you'd like and save a few bucks!

1Yc3n7NSJVTy6mjWzMNAAA.text: Very good Thai food.  Decor inside was questionable. Really. Why they have plastic fishes in the fish tank? A booth seat I sat had rips. I wasn't sure what to expect based on the decor here.  I was wrong. Food was in fact very good. I really liked their pineapple fried rice. Their curry spice level 2 has a nice spice to it, really loved the flavor.  Summer rolls were refreshing, great way to start a meal. Mango with sticky rice was just good to finish good lunch.  If I am in the area, I would definitely come back

photos.caption: Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pineapple Fried Rice
Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mango with sticky rice

q_dq0CAEjqLHbY0wksxwCg.text: Very authentic Thai flavors and dishes! While returning from Thailand a few months ago, I had an urge to seek out a good Thai restaurant this weekend. This place hit the spot. There was no wait on a Thursday night and no reservation needed. Quick service and very friendly staff! I ordered three dishes: Crab Wontons, Thai Beef Salad, and Pad Kee Mow (Drunken Noodles). Crab Wontons were full of Crab Meat and some of the best I've had around! Carrots and a Special Peanut Sauce served with these. Ordered the Thai Beef Salad with a #4 Thai Chili Pepper Index Level and didn't disappoint. Great seasoning and Spices with Broccoli, Cucumber, and Peanuts mixed in. The Drunken Noodles were a #3 on the Thai Chili Pepper Scale. Perfect stir fry with mixed veggies and basil. I Highly Recommend this place if you are in the Paradise Valley/Phoenix area!

photos.caption: Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pad Kee Mow (Drunken Noodles)
Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thai Beef Salad

JV37E3WomLRSqeCIAT0V2w.text: It disappoints me to give them a 1 star review as this was our go to place for Thai food for over 5 years. Unfortunately, Sala Thai just seems to not care about quality food or service any more. They just don't care about you, your order or experience with the food they deliver. Consistently, they forget items in your order, when you bring those concerns to the staff they laugh and tell you to wait and rarely rectify the situation. I would highly recommend you order from one of the other 4- star Thai restaurants that come up in the area.

IEg730J5RmdqLvpiQafoEQ.text: I have now eaten a few times since it is close to one of clients. In general the food is reasonable, the decor is terrible the worst being the plastic fish in the aquarium.   Food:3 Service:4 Parking: 5 Wine/beer: 3 Atmosphere:2  Overall: 3  Will be back since it is convenient

KcDgZC_ZZQkQO227P4mGBQ.text: This was my first time at Sala Thai at the suggestion of my friends. We ordered the Papaya Salad and to my surprise the seasoning was very tasty. Soon after we were served the Mus-Sa-Mun Curry, next came Spicey Pumpkin Basil all served with rice. Every item is spiced just right to the taste and all was yummy to say the least. For dessert we had the Coconut Ice Cream and let me tell this is an excellent ice cream to try. If you're up near here you must try this place. I did, with friends and I'm glad I did.

Also rice could be more plentiful as well. However, the food is always delicious and this is one of the better Thai restaurants I have visited in Phoenix.  Clean restaurant and very neat very staff.

yJhXGgAbaG7gA6rEM-YAHA.text: Ask for Jen! She was wonderful. The food was awesome. I got the pad sei ewwww and it was yuuuumm. I probably could have leveled up on the spice. "Jen  was  a  god  damn  gem"   -Bekah (expert Thai food consumer)

D3BQ3oV81n1lZn1i0bEICg.text: Enjoyed dinner here with friends. Have had many meals here. Spring rolls are excellent. The papya salad is always good and tangy. 6pnZ7jZbpn-WTaFREDEnjA.text: Sala Thai has really great curry. I recommend the yellow Thai curry and pai Thai. It's a great spot to call in and get to go.

rIpBCXUb2UeAzNYyj3LCNg.text: Was in the neighborhood and stopped by for lunch. They have one menu and don't have lunch specials, FYI. I ordered a pad thai with tofu (4/5 spice level) and a Thai iced tea with boba. Service was quick and friendly and the presentation of my dish was beautiful; I took a pic but it didn't save to Yelp. The taste of the pad thai was fine, I did like the thinner noodles but the tofu wasn't flavorful and the spice level was definitely not a 4, I like it to the point where I have trouble breathing and need a break. My drink was okay, there were a few hard boba balls and too much condensed milk/half and half or whatever it is that they use.   I may come back to try different menu items but pad thai is my deciding factor on whether I like a restaurant and they can improve this dish by adding more spice and changing the tofu.

photos.caption: Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rgPlvRC7f-gqqv9isIWq1Q.text: Food was awesome, and the layout of the space is pretty cool/different with the kitchen in the middle of the restaurant. I ordered the ChickenPanang Curry (my favorite Thai dish) with a "3" on their spicy level, but I probably could have ordered a 4 or 5. Sometimes it's hard to gauge how hot to get when its your first time at a new Thai place. A "3" at other places usually has my nose running lol definitely worth a try, and I'll be back soon.

-tdNKQq6RsZuMS2Fu2Vh8g.text: Sala Thai is great for a number of reasons. They use fresh ingredients, their dishes have great flavor, and they have a large selection of entrees to choose from. I've tried several things here and have never been disappointed. They also have great drinks. We love their thai iced coffee and their frozen boba drinks. The restaurant is always clean and they have a fun, colorful decor.

eMHQd8boDJpnOptHkZHjPA.text: The food was nothing out of the ordinary, but the efficiency and organization of the restaurant that night was absurd.  I was sitting in front of the kitchen and the food counter so I saw and heard pretty much everything.  I ordered a Thai iced tea, fried tofu, drunken noodles, and pineapple fried rice.  The waitress didn't write down my order, so I had to ask for my drink three times and waited for my food for about 25 minutes. I'm fine about waiting for my order, but not when my food is sitting and cooling on the counter for over 10 minutes.  I watched the waiters bicker about who would bus tables, prepare/refill beverages, take orders, and serve the dishes. There was no structure whatsoever. I hope they get it together...

P982K8Zj6lNmbI9QluxscA.text: I was craving Thai the last few days and really wanted some for lunch. I didn't think I was going to get any because I had errands to run on my lunch break, but it just so happened that this place was right down from where I was! I checked yelp before I went in just to be sure it was good. Some places are sketchy. I saw 4+ stars and was super excited.   I normally order some type of garlic entree, but I'm pregnant and have for some reason been craving curry all week! I ordered the yellow curry with chicken and no spice, and it was SO good. Normally with my pregnancy cravings I build something up in my head to be so amazingly delicious and then when I get it, my expectations were way too high and I end up disappointed. But this time, the curry was exactly what I wanted and I was extremely satisfied. It was creamy and had a lot of chicken.   I ordered it to go, and the service was fast and the waiter was very friendly.   My ONLY complaint is they don't have a lunch menu. I was hoping for some lunch special/combo with smaller portions, but they have the same menu all day. The meal was about $10 without a drink and I would have been much happier paying around $6 or $7 and getting smaller portion like at Thai Elephant or Thai Basil does.   Overall, I loved it and if I'm in the area again I will definitely be back.

LMkSQB4RmavEK0DBINmpJQ.text: Favorite Thai food in the state.    Start with one of the soups and move on from there (I recommend the Pork Wonton soup at a level 4 spice)  I hear the curry dishes are fantastic but I can't speak from experience as I tend to go with either Spicy beef with green bean or Thai Basil chicken.  (I'm more of a spicy meat and vegetable guy than a coconut milk guy)  My main tip for this place is for all of you drinkers out there.  If you have a hangover, and you want to cure it -   Step 1.  Get a cab here Step 2. Order the Drunken noodles at a level 4-5 (meat of your preference) Step 3. Don't leave until you've finished it.   Every toxin in your body will steam out of your pores and you will be left feeling amazing afterwards.  (I guess that bottom part is more of a drinking tip and than a Sala Thai tip - but take it if you want it)  Sala Thai is worth the trip.

SJr71eb-5HSIqTnN6LYuAw.text: Good prices! Really liked the crispy eggrolls. The Pad Thai and the pineapple fried rice were pretty good. The Pad Thai had a bit too much sauce for our taste. The Thai iced tea with boba was also pretty good. Will probably return.

g9K7FSgS0PEqHzR_5jY29A.text: Now this is real thai food.  Everything is fresh tasting including the shrimp.  All the dishes.ive tried have come out excellent.  We have yet to take food to go cause we eat it all.
