yIk2_EHorJXUWUlxLkL4WA.text: Food was excellent!!   Tried always fav pad Thai ...wonderful n just the right ammt if spicey!  And the yellow curry chicken... Was sooooo full because tasted so amazing! Prices were affordable!!  Happy campers ;))

WFyoL-KIK7ty2ge0bThoPA.text: We have been eating since they very first opened several years ago. The food has always been amazing. We ate here tonight and the food was mediocre at best and the service was absolutely horrible. Very doubtful we will be back anytime soon if ever.

wdk85KlH_06vIS_ZcJDo6Q.text: Food average.... Bad shrimp and service... Yikes! RUN

WG_3AKFfmbwZ_YJntnwxVw.text: I wonder if they got new owners, because I went in on a whim for some takeout and the place looked fairly different. New booths, and it looked like several young men in their 20's. A younger guy helped me order and he was really cool. I almost wished I was there with someone so we could dine in and see if the experience was any better than the last. I definitely want to check it out again!  The food was great, as usual. I knocked off a star because I think that despite the good food, the prices are just a little high for what you get.

Wjyr4mh1ERmUTAke_yOCiQ.text: This place is pretty solid.  The prices are reasonable and the food is really good.  Warning, they give you a spice level of 1 to 5.  I like it spicy so i chose a 4.  It was extremely spicy.  Next time I will probably scale down to a 2.  I had the veggie egg rolls and drunken noodles.  They were really good.  I ordered some Thai Ice tea to wash down the food, cause it was spicy.  Overall solid experience, the spiciness was my fault for ordering it that hot, but the taste of the food was solid.  I would recommend this place.

4MFGAQYbJHZOQWIhMegeyA.text: This place has reliable great food all the time, and is very reasonably priced for what you receive. The Coconut Milk Soup (Tom Krai Guy) is not to be missed, also their Drunken Noodles with Chicken is spectacular. I am a foodie and chef and decided to be active in reviews as a lot of awful food is getting good reviews, and  I'm not sure why, but we need to stop this

R-TmpkWyj5PYBSQQ5J_wZQ.text: Great spot, very consistent, excellent fresh made Thai food! You can't go wrong here for sure. I've eaten there several times with no disappointments.

cUuj0ONtDooddKA6259JmQ.text: Best Thai food around. I love this little place. Their catfish with panang sauce is amazing. Every time i try something new here it becomes my new favorite dish. I've taken a few people here and it's always been excellent. They don't serve alcohol, but they don't care if you bring your own in! It doesn't really look like much outside but inside is very colorful and usually packed with people. Im really glad I found this place.

cN79H-rYrc4YWaqkiqArcw.text: Wow, SO yummy!!  I'm here for lunch and eating the pumpkin curry with chicken at a level 4 spicy. I can taste so many lovely flavors and out has great spice too!!    My friend is having the phad see we, and he's been to Thailand many times, he's loving it too!  He thinks it's one of the best he's had anywhere!  I will be back!

_11xJjSJ198qotzBVAPnlw.text: Not the best Thai food I've had ( the best Thai food I've ever had was in Maui, and it was being cooked out of someone's back yard and sold on the side of the street) but it's pretty good.    I've had their coconut milk soup, pad thai, pad see ew, basil fried rice, green papaya salad, green curry, panang curry and garlic chicken.  All of these are good, although the basil fried rice is a bit too moist and garlic chicken a bit salty for my taste.  Like most other Thai places, the spice level is 1 thru 5 stars.   If you like a good kick, I would say go with 4 stars.  If you like super spicy, skip 5 stars and ask for "thai hot."  I'm a very observant person and to be honest, the many times I've eaten here, I noticed the crowd and they're the type to care about "ambiance" and service rather than the actual food.  For me, it's about how good the food is, then I factor in the service and all that stuff.    The service here isn't exactly top notch.  If you're one of those who care about being asked about how you're doing every 10 minutes, then don't come here.    Overall, for the prices and location and quality of food, this place is really good.  I haven't had a dish where I was like, ew!

aHiyuO0jy_VNhddeB6V_Xw.text: NOT VERY VEGETARIAN FRIENDLY,  My big problem is thai food revolves around Buddhist food, and Buddhist food is vegan. So when I dont see on the menu vegi options on the curries/ noodles it makes me quite upset.  That Said I found their Pad Thai overly sour (way too much tamarind), but ok. There is a saying for every thai there is a pad thai. Had the tofu and bok choi, (the only vegi option in the curry list) and it was REALLY GOOD. They call it a peanut sauce but it really is a peanut curry, think vietnamese ga sate style. The Pa Nang curry It was good but not "red" enough. Talking red curry not just red color. It was very nice but not wow.  The curries also needed more stuff in them (vegetables) and not more bell peppers seriously people.  What was nice was 3 of us left there after 3 entrees and 2 sodas for under $35. The staff was very nice and asked how spicy we wanted things. The menu is a bit daunting so dont be afraid to tell the waiter that you need some more time.  I know that one reviewer stated that nearly any dish can be made vegetarian, which is a duh statement, all they will do is leave something (the meat) out. In-n-out can make you a vegetarian hamburger sure it will just be the bun and the fixins with no patty. My point is that in thai cuisine meat is usually simply an add on but at this place meat is the star of the dish and that is the most wrong perspective.   Top tip for thai restaurant  eating look for a place that list its curries and noodles separate. Now there are other dishes that will always be listed with certain meats as well the dish revolves around that particular meat, but these are the exception in thai food.

-cLZfjuK5bs1DyHNeuftgA.text: Been here 5 times now and the food has been delicious every time. Some items can be spicy but it's worth the sweat storm.  Love the ribs! Prices are super reasonable. Fish talk needs a bit of cleaning though.

s2FaMNFQ27e2Qupd_BtUkQ.text: Service sucked, food sucked, location sucks, and they don't even serve alcohol!! It was a bad first date, only worse. First and last time at this hole.

uE9v-h2FDiM-qUQM4BLajg.text: Are kidding me? TERRIBLE service! I waited for 15 mins. W/O anyone coming to my table! I had to go up and get  my own menu and remind the staff I was waiting. Go to Wild Thaiger or Thai Rama...better food and WAY better service!

oUqFRxYNk4vaVjtSY-8NNQ.text: Cute little restaurant tucked in a small strip mall.  Went here on a friend's recommendation.    The food we had: pad thai chicken, pad thai vegetarian, asparagus something and spring rolls were all yummy.  and huge and very reasonably priced!  the iced tea was nice and fresh brewed, too.  The decor is fun and you must check out the real fake fish fish tank!  No 5 stars because the service was a bit off and there was no option for brown vs white rice.  Will definitely go back when I'm in the neighborhood!

mn8yzJGkjfux9qHpCHWdhA.text: Incredible food and service!  I had their pumpkin curry,  very good... unlike many Thai restaurants this one has a heat scale from 1 to 5 and I ordered a 5.  Now I like my curry spicy but a 5 might have been too much.    Try the green tea ice cream,  its delicious.   I will return to this gem.

vnyNgWaBm5gf0lLprK9qdg.text: This is the best Thai food in Phoenix.  Everyone I know loves this place.  I eat here all the time and have NEVER had a bad meal.  If you want great Thai in Phoenix, look no father than Sala Thai.

emZSs9QVot0UHnVKOZPhxQ.text: Seriously good curry. Serious. I'm not joking. I'm serious, the curry is very good. Usually when a restaurant has pictures of the food on the menu I become suspicious (think of Denny's and Village Inn), but here the photographs are not indicative of anything bad. In fact, the food looks good. Did I mention the curry is really good.

gO6AUpL7pi7KJGGLasfjLw.text: Okay so here's my dilemma...great food BUT they were recently on the dirty dining report...NINE VIOLATIONS. OUCH. I can see one or two, but NINE? I want to have their Drunken Noodles and Panang Curry again but not until they get a much better report! kpho.com/health/22798261...

Zc0ym33QN-Z431TU4Gl-JQ.text: pad thai and hot and sour soup rocks! love this place!

d_z60VT-6nkE_GxfAgj9jQ.text: Ok I'm so sorry to have to give such an update review.  I've been to Sala Thai several times since discovering it a couple of years ago.  I decided to take my really good friends for lunch a couple of weeks ago. When we walked it we sat on the newly expanded side.  They had recently doubled in dining space. The food of just okay this time.  I'm not sure if the cook of having an off day or what.  Well while we were eating and chit-chatting away my friend started to get all excited from across the booth telling me to get up and look behind me.  When I did I saw a roach crawling on my seat then scurry away to the next booth.  Okay I tried not to freak out myself and continued our lunch. Then my 7 year old starts to freak out next to me as he notices 2 roaches on the wall next to my friend across the table.  Okay that was it.  My son and friend got up and stood there until our bill came.  Our waitress came out and saw what the excitement was all about but do you think she said anything....of course not.  I assume this must be a normal thing for them now.  Well, needless to say I don't think I'll be returning to Sala Thai.

tBWrZ1-ejNiNw343parOhA.text: I love Sala Thai; the food is really great.  My only problem; the prices went way up and the size of the servings got much smaller!  We've all been in a pinch this year; your food is great but don't run customers off by under-serving.  Thanks!

1omGfGdLZgbvVfIa9DUJDA.text: Been coming here for a couple years.  Curry doesn't disappoint.  I like pumpkin, green, and panang.  Yum

fOgv-SzULegww9XCVnNywA.text: This is the first time trying this place and I have to say.... Great food!  This definitely a due over for the family. The Pad Thai has great flavor I would recommended this dish to everyone. Let me start out by saying Thai places are not created equally. This has set the bar to a whole new level. I am giving it 4 stars. The only reason for that is because I just had wished that the waiter would come check on us a little more often to see if we needed water or what not.

R8fwY6jPNLQUTs6a5cD8Gw.text: Tom Kra Gai = great.  Plus, the fake fish in the fish tank provide never-ending entertainment.

9KxYdQLsIPlieJpZAcy9KQ.text: Wow! This is the best Thai food I've had since Thailand! The atmosphere is delightful, the servers smile and promptly greet you, and the food is absolutely incredible. Try the panang, yum yum.

BsfVm_WTSGJjmhhQUxLecQ.text: Excellent yellow curry. Saw someone else ordered phad thai & it looked very nice. spring rolls were great, just the way they should be, good dipping sauce. Prices are very reasonable. very quiet & sufficient (though very small) restaurant, good for a casual date.

4GnJFlx5Z2SEA70YfLQpyw.text: I just love this place. Hard to find, but worth it.  The pumpkin curry is really interesting. Not ever had it before Sala, now it is one of my favorite dishes. The Ginger is also great.

QBJg4NB222v0NgFd-Q6yKQ.text: Good in a pinch, but nothing to write home about. For very good Thai food, check out Thai-Lana on Indian School.

XD-3adiOrAvcS6V5cFajiA.text: I went here for the first time on my birthday, and tried it again a few days ago. I've tried the chicken satay, egg rolls, Thai iced tea, pad Thai, Thai BBQ chicken, and the fried banana dessert with coconut ice cream. None of it disappointed. The wait staff are very friendly, the restaurant is clean, and the prices are reasonable.  I'm sure I'll continue to go back - if you go, definitely do the dessert - it's DELICIOUS!  Also, if you have a big party, you might have a tough time here unless you don't mind being split up - they have a few tables, but it's mostly booths that comfortably seat 2-4 adults.

O1n0fDxY_SFxjkD_hcQbTA.text: now a 2  the shrimp red curry and pad thai have now gone further down hill, lacking the flavors they used to have.  The Tom Yum soup?  horrible, so fishy.  We were so excite last night to go but I don't think we can go back.

QYyMEDxLRVXXQbGkBjBQIw.text: They have just expanded the place.  I have eaten here for years through several owners.  The food is fresh and very flavorful.  The people are delightful.  Having spent some time in Thialand, the food is somewhat Americanized.  Service is fine.  Definatly a hole in the wall type of place, with good food, nice people and very casual atmosphere.

kO1EsqnIMR1wb36y1HE0ng.text: After having take out from Sala Thai a few times, I can say that the quality of food is hit and miss. Staples such as egg rolls and pad thai are just simply disappointing. The eggs rolls are bland and their pad thai lacks the rich flavor that other thai restaurants serve. On the other hand, their curry and fried rice were quite good. Their take out service seems quite popular and as an apparent consequence, take out orders take longer compared to other restaurants. On the plus side, their prices are quite reasonable.

J2K4tcsh7Pj42lVnVlKLJA.text: This place is a bit hit or miss.  The Tom Kra Ga (coconut milk soup) is usually pretty good, sometimes better than others.....but always good. It's neat that you can get boba here. However, they recently started using smaller cups for beverages that aren't water. They still obviously have the regular size cups they used to use (they use them for water). It may not seem like a big deal, but now I'm literally getting half of the thai iced tea I used to and if you add boba, you'll drink it in 5 seconds. It is an extremely poor value and makes it seem like the business is cheaping out on the customer. Had drunken noodles that were really bland the other day.  The service is also hit and miss.

n3Jmr3Uj42tGUk19Zkr4kQ.text: Long ago and far away I lived in San Francisco wherein lies the delicious Lemongrass on Polk Street (near Union Street).  How I have I missed that temple of Thai cuisine.   Fast forward to 2016 and I have found Lemongrass' doppelganger, Sala Thai. These cats cook authentic Thai; i.e., peanut sauce, a staple for the American-gringo palette, was nowhere to be found on ST's extensive menu.   Everything was delicious. BBQ spareribs are bite-size and will be a new favorite. Their Thai Iced Tea is a new addiction (Waiter! IV of Thai Iced Tea!  STAT!  I'm Jonesing! was my cry of the repast.).  Pumpkin Curry was a great veggie accompaniment for the ribs. Fresh Spring Rolls were packed with fresh leafyness of lettuce, cilantro, carrot and delicate rice paper. Lettuce Wraps were terrific. Potstickers were moist, pan-crisped on the bottom.    Go hungry. Spend freely!

ebiV4sOTdqpCoRaeWAfx8A.text: Great family run independent business. The food is expertly prepared and properly seasoned per your request. Delicious and served with pride. The only negative is that they don't serve beer.

F9oFa7M3LV8W8YTbP2aU2A.text: Food has been great for years. Business has been getting busier and busier. Fun to watch a spot like this grow.   Unfortunately the last two visits service seems to be slipping. Seems to be a new staff. Don't recognize anyone. Our last visit we had to send our pumpkin curry back. They forgot the pumpkin!   I hope they get it fixed because we love this place and have for years. Again, great food and hopefully this is just a bump in the road and it will get resolved quickly.

RelnV6tJ_8Xp9Is138r-Kg.text: I ordered the pad Thai, side of white rice and an order of crab puffs as a pick up order. Order came to 25 dollars. It had to be the worst Pad Thai I've ever had.... and I'm not the pickiest person. If it wasn't 8:30 (they close at 9) I would have called them and returned it. It was honestly that bad. They didn't even put the peanuts on the side. Reign of Thai, up the street, is a hundred times better. Crab puffs were fine. Service was very fast and the gentleman that checked me out was very friendly, but I won't go back.

iu7J1aIup3y-awHEHRQcdw.text: Amazing Tom Ka coconut soup! The curry is also very good here. I've tried their Pad Thai a few times, however, and it has been rather slimy and overlooked each time.

wU1EsHa-1DUeLcKYcxRMJQ.text: As they say in the industry, consistency is key. This place is always that. Very good food at very reasonable prices. They should add a liquor license, at least beer and wine but you can byob which is nice too. We live in #thesheaborhood and eat here at least 2x a month. Its a regular go to and in over 10 years has never disappointed. Kudos to Sala Thai.

yix8NxES6nf5JYGNcCZ0Ew.text: Exceptional Thai food. My mother-in-law, husband and kids always order Pad-see-ew and I like all of the curries. The yellow is so good with beef, the red is spot-on but my perennial favorite is the green. They use just about every green vegetable they can get their hands on and the flavor of the curry itself is heaven.

wema3GndOQZyXZnrN1B2fw.text: Good food like the chicken chow mein. Go for more spicy than you are use to. Com paired to others there spicy is a little milder.

S8-cte58_nS1Wv4-rzf9aw.text: Food was excellent, veggies were super fresh and the meat cuts were beautiful.  Service is a little slow, but the food quality makes up for it. The heat range is 1-5, I ordered a 2 and man was it hot ~ just like I like it!  Sala Thai is an excellent restaurant.

MvuRHSZYM1Z0ZjnrACoioA.text: Having dinner here with my kids this time was still a treat. The portions are a little small for the price. But every dish has been great. Tom Yum is a must. The Basil Fried Rice is then other must have when we come. The only thing keeping my 5th star is the portion size. Not the typical family size dish for sharing.   Highly recommended Thai in PHX!

photos.caption: Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Appetizers. Crab wontons and Chicken Potstickers. Yummy
Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Never enough interior photos of restaurants. :)

Fouzf7yk_TtdKVS3Wv4y9A.text: I haven't been to Sala Thai since they added a whole new room of dining, which is saying something! The added seating means there is usually no wait. I'm back to say that I still love it! The basil friend rice wins awards for a reason, people, but the pineapple fried rice is good, too! However, it is very very spicy. Take the 1-5 scale seriously, I air on the wimpy side. My friend had the spicy pumpkin basil, which was pretty good, too. The menu is extensive, and I'm still perusing!  Everything on the menu can be made vegetarian, just request tofu or no meat. I wish they listed this somewhere on the menu instead of shunning you to the tiny vegetarian corner, which doesn't feature anything spectacular. I got the pad thai and found it a little lackluster.   The boba is wonderful, and wonderfully huge. I enjoyed the taro last time!

A1pvISLja89zrUQd83N8zg.text: TL;DR version: - Red Curry was WAYY over-salted. I usually enjoy salty food, but it was over the top. - After explaining I deal with severe allergies (namely onions and peas) the server listed all the vegetables to ensure nothing was included that I couldn't have. She said they could leave off the onions. The dish came out FILLED with snow peas, which yes, are still peas. It also had a huge leek in it despite explaining the severity of my onion allergy. - She offered to remake the dish, but I had zero confidence in their ability to make it without allergens, so I declined. They DIDN'T remove it from the bill.  We will never be going back here again. The whole experience was super disappointing and I will have to deal with an allergic reaction for 2-3 weeks because of their carelessness. If you also have food allergies or enjoy low blood pressure (aka not having ridiculously over-salted food), go elsewhere.

4CwG15lpmPQbOSjrrHoAoA.text: One of my favorite places to get tasty Thai Food in NE PHX. Normally come here on the weekends and bring the family and kids. Food is always good and the service is quick and friendly. Best of New Times.  Inside is both fun and inviting with some really comfortable booths. One is right next to a very cool looking fish tank with a lot of eye catching activity. Those crazy little critters are really flying and bouncing all over the place. The wife has to remind me that they are plastic fish and not to get too excited. Ha!  Nice selection of all your Thai restaurant favorites and more. They even have pictures on the menu of several dishes. This is always good when you are wanting to try something new and feel shy.  Like to order my dishes Thai SPICY Hot. The family members just laugh and prefer it more in the Medium range. You can always ask them to bring out more chilies if you want to start off with Mild and work your way up.  Some of our favorites are the Tom Yum (Hot and Sour), Tom Kra Gai (Chicken Coconut Milk) Soups. The Appetizers are all really good as well as any of the Noodle dishes, the different colored Curries, the Spicy Garlic versions, and the many BBQ items.  Bring the crew and ask for Thai Spicy if you dare. It is hotter than the 1-5 scale. Located in a small strip mall and easy to drive right past. SIMPLY YUMTACULAR!

photos.caption: Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tom Kra Gai - Chicken Coconut Milk Soup. Thai SPICY.
Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sliced Tofu Battered and Fried.
Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best New Times Thai Resturant 2008.

llebupP66e7f40OhZqmlzA.text: I would not even give them a 1 star, but then I wouldn't be able to write this. We saw the reviews on "Check Please",  and decided to hit it on the way home from my wife's job. Having a total of 75 years experience between the two of us in the restaurant and hospitality business, we were very disappointed. We contemplated leaving but decided to stay.Arrived Saturday at 6 pm. We checked in for a table, there were 4 open inside. Only waited a couple minutes because they had dirty plates and had to wipe and clean. The hostess brought us to the table and then left. We sat waiting for a server for 18 minutes before anyone acknowledged us. We put a order in for 2 sodas. We didn't receive any beverages that we ordered, including water from the time we satdown, was 38 minutes. When the server did bring soda, she only brought one. Huh? Other diners next to us were seated and brought water for each person. After we finally caught a server, I asked about my soda and she replied that they ranout of clean glasses. Kinda strange because considering the soda and water were the same glasses. When the server finally came to our table, after my my wife went up to tell someone we were ready to order, which was 53 minutes since we were seated, she didn't even mention any of the specials. We decided to order appetizer, food and desert all at once so we could get our food. Watching the front door get filled with a line of people, we noticed a large amount was to go food. The number of To Go Orders had to have come after we were seated. It seemed like the To Go Orders were more important then the customers seated inside. More food To Go was going out then inside. When the server brought food, she only brought chicken skewers. At least we had something. When we tried it, it was cold. Hey we are really trying here. Our food finally arrived. Mine first, then my wife's 5 minutes later. She ordered curry and never received the rice to go along with it. We flagged down a server and she brought the rice. So much confusion. I had the Pahd Thai shrimp with extra shrimp. When meal came, I ate the shrimp, and counted each shell on a plate totally 9 pieces total. Being a big guy and a big eater, if I buy it I will eat it.  I couldn't even eat half of my meal. Something was not right. I had my wife try my dish and she said it was off too, so it wasn't just my taste buds. Not seeing a server in a long time, my wife decided to go up and try and get a soda refill. She did say the owner was nice. We we were finished with meal and waited for our sticky rice which never came so my wife went to check on it. They said 10 minutes which turned into 20 minutes. So sad. The diners next to us who came in 35 minutes after us got check and were out before us. Since server didn't check on us, I asked her for the check. It came 15 minutes later. By the way , my meal was $10 and the 4 pieces of extra shrimp were $9. I should've bought another entree because I would've got noodles too for a $1 more. C'mon, really? All said and done, it was a total of 1 hour and 28 minutes of HELL. 2 Thumbs down. I have never been so disappointed in restaurant ever. And I go out alot. I do Consulting for restaurants for those who ask for help. My advice from sitting 2 tables from restrooms in back is; You need a designated busser. You need food runners. You need a hostess, not a server seating customers. You need a designated Phone / To Go person, not a server who should be taking care of Guest and their food. Your place should have 1 server on one side and one server on other and one for outside. You need to have Cooks make food in order it comes in, not To Go food first. Your Big Impression is for the Guests inside. First timers like Me. Then I will order food To Go next time. For being the size you are, there is to much Chaos. Time Management Problem.

aVeukp3l6yM9-XqnED2TGA.text: Had pad ti with beef #4 spicy . Nice heat. Normal crap puffs. Very filling. Also ordered drunken chicken heat 3 .

61gW5ql1ja2Rbm7E4cjpGg.text: Hands down the best Thai in the valley. A bit of a hole in the wall but I think that is what makes it so charming and authentic. Love the green curry....SPICY!!!

7fhyWCC2yMFH5g8RjrSYkA.text: Yum! I just tried this place for the first time today and all I can say is delish! I like the decor, it's a nice clean atmosphere. They have really big booths that makes it comfortable to eat. Food is amazing! We ordered the phad se ew (my favorite Thai dish) so far its the best I've found in Phoenix since my mom's recipe. The basil fried rice was also good, rich flavors and the perfect level of spice! I think I found my new thai spot! I totally will be returning!    Oh and Check out the fish tank full of fake fish,  its interesting. Haha

photos.caption: Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef phad se ew

j1bu1HV6BY4Q4YPPh6aXXA.text: I came with a group of five including 5 year old twins  We ordered a variety of things including egg rolls, spring rolls, vegetable pad thai, masala curry, pumpkin curry, and chow mein.  The pad thai was the worst I have ever had.  It was mushy and had a weird tomato base flavor.  How do you mess up pad thai?! I actually sent it back to order the chow mein to keep things simple. The waitresses on staff that evening seemed inexperienced.  I really did not like the food. The best thing we had was the masala curry.  Oh the kids loved the mocktails!  My cousins frequent this establishment often and they were also disappointed with the service. Maybe it was an "off" day, but I will not be back

6N4U9PBx6EVVa7HJDr-7qg.text: Best Thai in the Valley! I usually order the Tom kra gai! All the curries are fragrant thick and lovely. Also the spring rolls are perfection!

14CJWE-w0tKQi5ifhfQWrQ.text: I didn't know what to expect when I walked into Sala Thai, but I was pleasantly surprised with the traditional Thai decoration. There were definitely lots to look at - the walls and the counters were filled with decorations. I personally didn't understand the point of a "fish tank" with plastic fish floating around, contrary to the others that seem to love it - I guess it just depends on taste.  We were seated, and were given plenty of time to look over their extensive menu.   I ordered the Chicken Barbecue plate and my sister ordered the curry. For the chicken barbecue, the presentation of the food was great, but the taste of the food was okay at best - the chicken was a bit tough to chew on. It really wasn't my favorite. The curry was better - it had a thick coconut aftertaste which I enjoyed. I would recommend the curry rather than the barbecue.   The reason why I gave this place three stars was because of the service. The waiters were never 'rude' per say, but they just seemed non-existent! They might as well make this place a self-serve restaurant because the waiter gave us the food but never checked in once. My sister and I were tired and in need of water because we came from walking in the heat but our waters were never refilled. My sister wanted more rice for her curry but no one came by to check up on us. It seemed like the waiters didn't put any effort to attending us other than taking our order and dropping off the food. Additionally, we were ready to leave for a while before they arrived with the check.

photos.caption: Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Random floating display of... plastic fish?
Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken barbeque

MijfuwViu5sWZVTKPyrCZw.text: The spicy green bean chicken is a go-to favorite for my family! 1 order serves 2 adults very nicely and the service has always been exceptional. Please note, they are closed on Mondays now.

Tt29dZ6l9E73ROVIiusIOg.text: Sadly, I'll probably never eat here again. My wife and I used to order curry dishes from here regularly, but hadn't for a while because it was never consistent. Half the time it was great, but the rest of the time it was watered down. After deciding to give them one more chance tonight, I was grossly disappointed. My panang curry was so bland that it literally tasted like chicken in nothing but water with cayenne flakes.

m6UyuCLhzB4mTqTa6uovcQ.text: Sala Thai is one of my favorite Thai restaurants. Highly recommended. It's a small neighborhood establishment that makes some of the best pumpkin curry around. I also appreciate their 1-5 heat scale. Let me warn you, however, never go above a "three" unless you like your Thai food really hot.   In addition to traditional Thai offerings, the menu also contains a few Chinese dishes in case your party is not 100% onboard with Thai. Yes, it's a small restaurant with occasional small restaurant issues, but the presentation of the food is often consistent with a much more expensive destination. And the decor! It's hard to describe. Let's just say it's fun.

EZRSAx3wssjr_oGRRudjJw.text: Yum! I have been a loyal customer here for fifteen years. The food is great! The service is somewhat lacking but its nothing to get worked up about. Just try to be ready to order when your server comes around, because you may not see the server again for a good while. Often times, I find that there is only one server working the entire restaurant. They could probably use more than one for busier times. Only four stars because the decor is a little strange here. Overall, its a great place that I will continue going to as long as they will have me!

gghFQCvB5z480PtY5X7Kdg.text: This used to be my favorite place for Thai food. We ate here once a week when I was pregnant, because I craved it. The last two times I've gone, I've noticed a decrease in portions and quality of my favorite dish with a $2 increase in cost. It's disappointing and I will probably go here again, but will order something different.

bpmru2z7fB9Nj_m7rE-sKA.text: This place was recommended by a coworker so we tried it on a Friday night. We were seated and that was the end of it. The table seated about 10 minutes after us was served water and then their order was taken and we were still sitting there with no beverage and no food ordered. An employee peeked over the kitchen wall and saw us not being served first and did nothing. We walked out 20 minutes after entering the establishment with no food or beverage.  Was very disappointed as many people have since told us that they love this place and the food is amazing.  Not sure if they deserve a 2nd chance. Will have to take some time to get over it.

1gS8Wng_REAnzMWRsbW6ag.text: VERY DISAPPOINTED! Servers are bad & lazy. Can't even rate the food because they screwed up the order. We went in at 8:20pm & simply ordered papaya salad, tom-yum soup, & pad Thai... NOTHING COMPLICATED! Yes, soup & salad came out quick because it wasn't busy. Wait for 30 mins close to 8:55pm, finally decide to walk up & ask about the pad thai.  They forgot to cook it and said it was crossed out! Omg that's all I wanted to come here for! The whole time they don't even come check on us for water, or if we need anything else .

D1CyaMrY20xgtl17qW8wUQ.text: Green curry dish was very good, although consistency of the soup was too thin, but maybe is because we order the level 1 of spicy; also ordered fish cakes with sweet Thai sauce with peanuts but I was expecting to enjoy some shrimp cakes, unfortunately they do not carry in their menu.

OUEpKL_SUP66FJXFfTh2nw.text: Went in on a Sunday afternoon for the first time.  I ordered the Drunken Noodles with chicken, and my friend ordered the Pad Thai. We both enjoyed our dishes. I wasn't crazy about the pad thai but loved the Drunken Noodles and would definitely order again. We both also got the coffee frozen drink. (They offer many different flavored "Mocktails" and it was very good).   The only thing I wasn't crazy about was the service. It was friendly, but I had to ask for things a couple times before I got them. Not a big deal but the reason why I withheld a star. I would recommend the food and will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coffee blended drink
Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pad Thai
Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Drunken Noodles with chicken. Delicious!

sVTP8HQVGjs-S9_AFKStZg.text: Fantastic little neighborhood Thai restaurant. We're all about the Pumpkin Curry, but Sala Thai has a lot more than one dish to offer.   The atmosphere. It's intimate, with pretty much every square inch of wall space filled with kitschy artwork and memorabilia.  The napkins. Neatly folded in birdlike form with a fork inserted.  The presentation. Food is served in a manner consistent with a much more expensive restaurant.  The menu. Pumpkin Curry! What more need be said?  In all seriousness. I love the food. There is plenty of variety on the menu. Those in search of heat will find it. Those not can find safe refuge. Servers routinely ask for your heat preference on a scale of one to five, with five being hottest. Keep in mind it's an Asian scale. I'd suggest you go no higher than a three, my preference, even it you like your food spicy. Go higher at your own risk.  They will ask you to pay in cash if possible. We paid with a credit card on our most recent visit, without problem or comment. It's just a small business understandably trying to avoid high credit card fees. I'm fine with that if it helps keep their prices reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States

oGrRXncK-97Ew-JzdUC5PQ.text: This is one of our go to's for Thai food. All of the curries are delicious. And make sure you order the Thai spring rolls! My husband loves their Thai tea. So good! The staff is very friendly.

ELXzXwjZU3e44SCcwBOcOA.text: Found this place on Yelp, I was looking for a new Thai place near me. All the reviews were positive so...why not?! We were able to pick our seats so we sat next to the big fish tank full of little plastic fishies. Cute. Our forks and napkin were decoratively wrapped together...also a nice touch.  We ordered some of the veggie egg rolls to start. They were pretty good, very crisper and hot. For our entrees we both ordered drunken noodles, me beef and my son chicken. I had my heat at a level 3 but my son ordered a level 4. My dish was pretty good with some heat but not enough to overtake the flavor of the food. I can tell my son's food was hot, I could see it on his face, but he enjoyed his as well.   Overall, this is a good local place to grab some Thai food. Friendly staff, and not too pricey.

photos.caption: Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The fish tank!
Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pretty napkins!
Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Egg rolls

kp250bqUFSlC3VeV7e9loA.text: Delicious. We just moved to the area and have ordered here three times.  Everything has been hot and fresh and prepared quickly. The staff is super nice and repeat our phone orders to us when we come in to pick up just to be sure they got it right. The yellow curry is so delicious. I order spice level 4 and it is completely satisfying. My boyfriend gets basil fried rice, also delicious, it's a little sticky and saucy-yum. Give this place a try. Oh the dining room is quaint and warm and inviting.

39Z6SAh3nsVAyljpIimjKQ.text: We have been back a few times again and the dishes have been consistently good and fresh. We are now regulars.

CNS3zN1xYPT8IF6EgKHUYA.text: Best Thai Food restaurant so far in Arizona.  Price are reasonable.  Clean and friendly staff.  I highly recommend to anyone who loves Thai food.

Photo of Sala Thai - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2feni5J8WuDJM_YSKhmFTw.text: The food here was nicely presented and yummy. Came in and got seated right away. Service wasnt bad they refilled my water and checked on me a couple times. The panang curry was nice just wish i ordered it more spicy. I love spicy foods. The thai tea was good. Pad thai is delish i always ask for extra sauce cause i like my noodles drenched in sauce. Cant wait to go back

KiB7jKzKJ0n-a6MKZz5fDQ.text: Great locally owned authentic Thai!!  Their lettuce wraps appetizer is a full meal for me!

imINDgJ6Gcisrw5iqNPnMw.text: This is my first time eating Thai in Phoenix so I'm only comparing to what I'm used to. The food was bland and the curry was soupy. I prefer my curry to be a little thicker. The drunken noodles had a little too much veggies and not a lot of flavor. To make things worse, I ordered brown rice and found that they gave me white rice when I got home.

rWN_FxyteiPwZEgVM8UnWA.text: Not a return place-- I was disappointed in the preparation of the the food I ordered and received.

r7Wl46_OI1ucGRo2fnVmTA.text: Really excited to have a new place to dine near home. Went tonight and I wasn't very hungry and really wasn't in the mood for jack, but had plans to meet a friend. So I perused their expansive menu and saw about 10 things I thought might be really good! Decided to try something off-the-wall with the thai omelette; meat, peas, carrots, and glass noddles inside egg? Why not!?  It was really quite good and did a great job of bringing me out my funk without trying to bowl me over.  The place was a small strip-mall location, but it was busy when there wasn't anyone in sight at the places around it. I'm not a Thai food connousieur, so I can't vouch for the authenticity. All I know is I had a good meal for a reasonable price and I'll go to bed happy knowing that I have a new dinner option nearby.

LILlWF8JrkcUjWVKIapkAw.text: We had the Basel Duck and it was not bad, it was awful.  I complained but the response was it wasn't their fault.  They refused to make any concessions.  We were charged almost $40 and we didn't eat the duck because it sucked.  Be aware.  There people take no responsibility for serving a bad meal  I will never go back to this place.

BuFQ2tBZ1Wd1KPK8w13sBg.text: I went here for dinner with my parents and had a wonderful experience. We brought our own bottle of wine, which was cool, and we shared the chicken lettuce wraps, which were awesome and came with three good sauces. It was a notably large portion for an appetizer and could easily be shared by 3-4 people. For dinner, I ordered the green curry with chicken and brown rice, on a 4 (out of 5) spice level. It was very spicy, as I was hoping for, and I admire anyone with the courage to order the 5. Everything was cooked nicely, all of the right flavors were there, and it was amongst the best green curries I've ever tried. I was able to snag a bite of the duck curry (which was in an orange-colored sauce which included pineapple [yummmm]) and a seafood special, which contained shrimp, scallops, catfish and a variety of vegetables. All three entrees were delicious and exceeded my expectations! As far as service went, the waiters were very friendly and attentive. The ambiance was very nice and, overall, it was a five star experience for a reasonably priced Thai restaurant. I definitely recommend swinging by if you're craving a mean green curry!

z8Sv-vMkn6Sp6ntB422_oQ.text: I ate here again the cashew chicken was fantastic! I will be here again in the near future.

N7qkPR5g70o8SyZC9pnarA.text: We went to Sala Thai for my sisters birthday since she is a big fan of Thai food.  As for myself, i could do without curry, but will try not to let that influence my review.    When we got there, there seemed to be plenty of seating and the waitress seemed quite accommodating.  We ordered a ton of food including Tom Yum soup,pad Thai, pad Sui,  curry chicken, BBQ beef, and pineapple fried rice.  Like I said earlier, I'm not a huge fan of curry but i did try some and I liked it more than I normally do.  I did not however try the Tom Yum soup just because I don't like it in general.  The pad Thai and pad Sui (spelling?) was OK,  but I feel like I've had better.  What I did love however was the pineapple fried rice and BBQ beef.  I could not get enough of it!  I almost finished the entire serving of fried rice by itself.    So to sum up my review, if you are a fan of Thai food, I think you will enjoy it a lot (my sister swears by it and spent a year in Thailand). However,  I'm just not a huge fan of Thai food, and although they do offer a lot of neutral plates (BBQ plates come to mind), their specialty items I find are lacking.

qqdLXbreWDEHt_1L4Mp-ow.text: I have driven by this unassuming place many times and always wondered how the food was. My daughter and I had lunch here today and shared an order of crab wontons, cashew chicken, beef ribs and beef with yellow curry.  Everything was really good and there was plenty left over to take home.  We got the spiciest option for the curry and it was delicious.  We will definitely go back and try some other things next time.  The noodle dishes looked very good.

Yyk3k8SBkI3ltFOGy_vXzw.text: Smells and tastes just like the food my Burmese friends make. Delicious yellow curry, pleasant wait staff and prompt service make this a very appealing place to eat in or take home to enjoy.

2sV-EmZl8eEwV8rBea55Ww.text: Casual and comfortable atmosphere.  I had the Pad Woon Sen,  it was delicious.  My husband had the Pad Thai, also very good. The staff was friendly and food was delivered in great time. We will definitely be back.

dterF578s3asCYVoX8ms9g.text: I'm traveling cross-country with my parents from NYC and we were all really craving some yummy, authentic Thai food (Pam's Kitchen + Pongsri in NYC are both amazing and right up our alley).  Ended up going to Sala because of all the reviews. Have to say - we all loved it!  We got their basil fried rice based on the reviews - and it was awesome.  We also ordered the drunken noodles, the spicy basil leaves with soft tofu and another with chicken (minced).  Everything was delicious!  In fact, between the 3 of us, we finished almost everything.  Kind of ridiculous.  Also, 4 out of 5 (spicy level) was perfect.  We love spicy food and it was the perfect amount of heat.  I would equate it to medium spicy in NYC Thai restaurants, which is really quite spicy but perfect if you can handle heat.  Oh, and not sure about peoples' tastes but we don't love sugar in our Thai food - so if you're the same, be sure to let them know not to add extra sugar.  We forgot to do that and although some dishes were a tad sweet(er), we didn't particularly mind because of the heat.  Still, next time, I would say no sugar.  Also, we ordered the coconut ice cream for dessert and it was great.  Subtle coconut flavor (not too essence-y) topped with toasted coconut.  Alsooo, the servers were really nice.  We arrived at like 8:45pm and despite closing at 9pm (kitchen closes), our server was super sweet.  Would definitely go back to Sala Thai if we're ever in the area again!!!!

QAZ82TY7SCO_5dG3cYjUtA.text: Tom Kha soup is the star here. A small (half) order is more than enough for a meal; you have to ask for half order, it's not on the menu. Super flavors. Not knowing the portion size, I ordered the green curry chicken, too. I love spicy, and ordered it the hottest they offered. I was disappointed that it was still fairly mild for five chili pepper rating. It's worth the trip - authentic place.

srdcq-eu434fN-xmHGm1eA.text: This is one of those rare reviews I will write that SG does not agree. We typically feel the same way on restaurants and the food. I actually think he would give this place a 4 or 4 1/2. That being said, I am writing my review and you will get my perspective. He's on his own.  Staying in Scottsdale, we found ourselves not having to have dinner with the crew. YA, no bar food. This was our opportunity to have good food of our choice without having to deal with all those guys. So, yelp on the mission to find something not too far from our resort with good ratings. Sala Thai came up fairly highly ranked and pretty darn close (and open a bit later on a weeknight, as it was around 8pm).  This place is in a little strip mall, small and hard to find if you are not looking for a store front. Someone had made reference to it in their review, so we did not have much trouble. We pulled on in and walked in to be seated. The place has lots of greenery and Thai decorations. All the seating appeared to be in booths though there may have been a table or two toward the back. There were quite a few people here as well, but we were seated right away.   The menus have lots of pictures and some very creative drink options. We ordered a slushy thai tea to share and continued to look at the menu. There were quite a few creative Thai dishes that you do not see other places and we decided that we would stray just a little from our norm. I was dead set on papaya salad, since I felt I needed some fruit after all the bar food I had been eating. We also ordered pad see ew beef and pumpkin chicken.   The drink took forever to come. I think there may have been only one person in the back cooking, though there were two young people hostessing and taking orders. The food arrived close to the same time as the drink. The papaya salad, though we ordered medium spicy, was HOT HOT HOT. We were both dying. We usually can tolerate spicy, but this was almost too hot to eat. We did not even finish what was on the plate and typically I would eat that more than the other stuff. The Pad see ew  was ok, not as good as would have liked. Just not as flavorful. The pumpkin chicken was good. Different. I picked out and ate most of the pumpkin.   I just felt very unsatisfied by the meal. The food was just ok. I have had so much good Thai food that this one just did not live up to my standards. So much for a good non-bar food night. But at least the Thai tea was great, once it came. Maybe we just did not order the right stuff and should have ordered mild on the spice for the papaya salad. I am sure there are other Thai places in the area, so I will likely not go back (even if SG voted to go back).

PY_Nz22QhOEECwMdaJtkcQ.text: All around a good Thai restaurant! The food was really delicious. I had what I always get at Thai places... Yellow curry with chicken. no beer at this restaurant but yet their open close sign is sponsored by a Thai beer called Chang, which is a really great beer must try. My only gripe was the service. They were nice enough but the service was awkward. They would ask you a question and walk away before you could answer. Usually I would blame that on how busy it was but... We were the only people in the shop. Again, over all a great place to eat and I recommended it if your in the area.

Yfb567Xn3kIWEVSEcbm2Qg.text: This is an excellent little Thai joint, great for takeout, excellent Tom Kha Gai, Pad Thai is OK, Love the fresh spring rolls.    I'm a huge fan.

zMAVn933XyVvDEwc-4nUmw.text: Every Thai place I always get the same item(at least once). That makes comparing much easier. I always get the Spicy Basil w/Tofu and brown rice(if you don't have brown rice then you get deducted at least a star and DON'T tell me brown rice and white rice are nutritionally the same, really? Read a book! ). Sometimes I throw on a side of steam Broccoli for good measure but not always. Sala is the closest decent Thai place to where we currently live so I would say we frequent Sala more then any other Thai place in the Valley.  We get take out 50% of the time and eat in the other times. Only once can I think of that the order was jacked up at all(no brown rice). Usually service is quick and no hassle. Food is quite consistent, sometimes the vegetables on the dish change, but it's always a surprise and works so why not!  They have the typical decent veg/vegan selection and will do a fish sauce replacement(plum I think) if you ask. My only minor complaint is that sometimes the heat level is not consistent, I like it HOT but Thai Hot some places is HOTTTTT, other places its just mild. Usually if I ask for hot, it's a good level but sometimes it is off(usually weak).   I won't say it's my favorite Thai place in the valley but it is in the top 3 for sure (at least top 5...yeah top 5) and I have given them plenty of times to disappoint.

ETvK-HI_jtRXfEQzUd3Ieg.text: Not so good. They''ve expanded their dining area but the food is still mediocre at best for Thai food.  But then I'm spoiled I lived in Thailand for 8 months. Ok I ve been back and the food was tremendous I not sure maybe I had an off night last time. Awesome flavors, authentic spices. I highly recommend Sala Thai.

q-Em3PucHtn4jVpUal37QA.text: The 2 of us went to Sala Thai last night and expected so much better based on these reviews on yelp. We looked at the menu on line and knew the prices were high and thought they must be good at those prices.   Ok the Thai Tea will get a high rating for sure.  The place was busy. The booth seating was comfortable and the fish tank with the plastic fish was interesting. The hangings on the walls were pretty.  But the reason we were here was to try a different Thai Restaurant. Once we ordered our food it came out too fast. It must have already been cooked. The Beef Panang had no flavor and the sauce was too thin.  The beef in it was tough and had stringy bits as well. The toughness made me think microwave. But I have no fact about that. The broccoli floating in the Panang sauce tasted good. The Pad Thai seemed to be a glued tangled mess of various size noodles. It was loaded with fried egg. No flavor.  The Stuffed angel wings were huge and not sure what the stuffing was as we couldn't identify it.  A bit of a freezer taste. Hot on outside but not warm in the middle. The cover up flavor came from the sweet chili sauce we poured over it. We had to ask for more sauce.  No one ever came to see how our food was until the end when they brought the check. Yet we were still eating or trying to when they brought the check.  We left so much food on our plates and paid $37.00 and left. We have been eating Thai Food for over 25 years in the Valley and do have our favorite places. However , living  North of the main city, there are not a lot of Thai Restaurants to choose from. We have to make a 35 minute drive to get to one. We will not return to Sala.  We will not go back there.

FnIt7eiDgo3O66kyv6jlsA.text: So glad to have found great Thai in my neighborhood.  We thought when we moved away from Tempe that we had lost our access to great ethnic food.  Luckily we found this little gem.  Great ambience, friendly quick service, and fantastic food.  We ordered the green curry chicken and the drunken noodles with vegetables.  Great sized portions for reasonable price.  We got ours on a 3 out of 5 scale of heat and it was perfect for us.  I have a feeling we'll become regulars.

zALssNCSGh9kiX5gDoRDhA.text: Best Thai food in the valley.  The service is unbelievable.  A little tip - if you ask for more shrimp, they will give you more, a little extra cost, but well worth the price.  All of their meals are great.  Love the Spicy Basil and Drunken Noodles.  Their soups are great too!  The staff is always friendly.  Great place!!!!!!

m0wKIqa_VU29jcJ-G3bmDQ.text: Yumyumyumyumyumyum!!!! So delicious but a little bit on the slow side for lunch. Never went for dinner yet.

fpzxAX-MZUyZGocPB9eXSQ.text: Drunken Noodle with Beef, 5 hot!!!!! Pad Thai at a 4 woo Hoo!!! This is the best Thai food I have found in PHX, thank you!!
